excerpt: TechnipFMC has been awarded an iEPCI contract by bp for the 20,000-psi Tiber development in the Gulf of America Paleogene, extending the subsea contractor’s backlog in one of the basin’s most technically demanding frontiers.

excerpt: Expectations that Venezuela could quickly rebound to historic output near 3 MMbpd are running into hard infrastructure and capital barriers, according to commentary from global analyst firms.

excerpt: Continental Resources has signed an agreement with Pan American Energy to acquire non-operated interests in four blocks in Argentina’s Vaca Muerta shale. The deal expands Continental’s footprint in the Neuquén basin as the company builds a long-term international unconventional portfolio.
title: Continental Resources expands Vaca Muerta position through Pan American Energy agreement

excerpt: Decom Engineering and Unique Group have signed a memorandum of understanding to jointly deliver integrated subsea decommissioning services across key oil and gas regions, including the Middle East and Asia-Pacific.
title: Decom Engineering and Unique Group form subsea decommissioning partnership

excerpt: Transocean has added approximately $168 million to its firm backlog through a new deepwater drilling contract with bp offshore Brazil and a contract extension for its harsh-environment rig offshore Norway, strengthening utilization into 2027.
title: Transocean wins bp Brazil drilling contract, extends Norway work through 2027

excerpt: The Government of Oman has signed a feasibility study agreement to evaluate heavy crude oil development in Block 71 using advanced electric heating technology. The study will assess technical and commercial viability ahead of potential appraisal drilling and a future long-term concession.
title: Oman signs feasibility study to advance heavy oil development in Block 71

excerpt: Mozambique LNG illustrates how shifting climate policies, security assessments and political priorities in key financing countries are slowing African LNG projects, raising costs and extending development timelines across the continent.
title: Mozambique LNG highlights how global politics are delaying regional projects

excerpt: Touchstone Exploration has reported thick gas-bearing Herrera sands and a newly identified Karamat gas play at its Carapal Ridge-3 well in Trinidad, with completion and facility tie-in planned for early 2026.
title: Touchstone advances Trinidad gas development with Carapal Ridge-3 results

excerpt: U.S. Energy Secretary Chris Wright is expected to meet with oil industry executives this week to discuss the potential revival of Venezuela’s oil sector, as companies weigh long-term investment risks following recent political upheaval.
title: Trump energy team to meet with oil execs on Venezuela sector rebuild

excerpt: Chevron and other U.S. oil stocks climbed after President Donald Trump pledged to revive Venezuela’s oil industry following the capture of Nicolás Maduro. Analysts say Chevron, which operates under a U.S. sanctions waiver, is best positioned to benefit, though rebuilding Venezuela’s aging oil infrastructure could take years.

excerpt: Analysts say Venezuela’s political upheaval is unlikely to disrupt global crude supply in the near term, but uncertainty around sanctions, exports and investment could reshape upstream dynamics in 2026 and beyond, with Chevron viewed as best positioned among U.S. majors.

excerpt: U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Washington’s oil “quarantine” is giving the U.S. significant leverage over Venezuela, as sanctioned crude shipments are seized and exports constrained.
title: Rubio: Venezuela oil quarantine key to U.S. pressure strategy

excerpt: Global oil markets are showing little reaction to Venezuela’s political shock, as swelling supplies and a deepening surplus blunt price impacts. Analysts say rising non-OPEC output and OPEC+ policy discipline are likely to keep crude prices under pressure despite heightened geopolitical risk.

excerpt: Chevron has delivered first oil from its South N’dola platform offshore Angola, bringing new production online in Block 0 through a tieback to existing offshore infrastructure.

excerpt: Occidental has completed the $9.7-billion sale of its OxyChem chemical business to Berkshire Hathaway, strengthening its balance sheet and upstream focus.

excerpt: Baker Hughes has completed the closing of its surface pressure control JV with Cactus, marking a shift in ownership and capital allocation within the upstream equipment sector.

excerpt: Wallstreet Sand Co. has brought dry frac sand operations online at its Kermit, Texas facility, expanding in-basin proppant supply to support Permian basin completion activity and logistics efficiency.

excerpt: Peru has announced plans to restructure Petroperu and explore separating the $6-billion Talara refinery, as the state firm faces liquidity challenges and $5.45 billion in debt.

excerpt: Gabon is advancing major energy-sector reforms aimed at boosting upstream investment, separating its hydrocarbons framework into new oil and gas codes and unlocking deepwater potential. Growing production, offshore exploration agreements with bp and ExxonMobil, and LNG megaprojects position Gabon as a rising player in Africa’s oil and gas landscape.

excerpt: African producers are turning regulatory reform into real upstream gains. From Angola’s $70B project pipeline to Nigeria’s accelerated licensing and Congo’s LNG expansion, policy shifts are reshaping investment across the continent.

excerpt: Nigeria’s NNPC is preparing to develop new oil fields beginning next year as part of a plan to boost national output and raise up to $30 billion by 2030. The state-owned producer is also weighing divestments of non-performing assets and expects to launch bid rounds early in 2026.

excerpt: Oil prices finished 2025 with their sharpest annual decline since 2020, as WTI fell 20% amid surging global supply, OPEC+ output increases and record U.S. production. Market watchers expect oversupply to persist into 2026, despite geopolitical risks and upcoming OPEC+ policy decisions.

excerpt: Bollinger Shipyards has secured a contract to build four U.S. Coast Guard Arctic Security Cutters, advancing U.S. icebreaking capabilities and Arctic operational presence.

excerpt: Venezuela has begun shutting oil wells in the Orinoco Belt as U.S. blockade measures halt crude flows, forcing PDVSA to cut production by an estimated 25% due to storage constraints.

The move strengthens CB&I’s footprint in international energy markets and diversifies revenue beyond EPC work.

excerpt: As offshore oil and gas activity expands across the Caribbean, investment in shore bases and specialized ports is becoming essential to project execution. From Guyana and Trinidad to Suriname, logistics hubs are increasingly shaping timelines, costs, and operational reliability for deepwater developments.

excerpt: Libya has launched a 22-block bid round with revised fiscal terms designed to lure global energy investors, but analysts warn that political and infrastructure risks could determine whether the country’s upstream revival gains lasting traction.

The deal is expected to significantly boost production and proved reserves, with development planned into the early 2030s.

excerpt: TC Energy praised House passage of the SPEED Act, saying streamlined federal permitting would accelerate energy infrastructure projects and strengthen U.S. energy security.

excerpt: NOIA welcomed House passage of the SPEED Act but urged the Senate to strengthen permitting reform to avoid new uncertainty for U.S. energy investment.

excerpt: Brent crude slipped below $60/bbl for the first time since May, as rising global supply continues to outpace demand. A growing surplus outlook for 2026, combined with easing geopolitical risk premiums, is adding fresh pressure to oil markets.

excerpt: The Middle Eastern oil market has weakened in recent weeks on concern that regional supplies will outstrip demand, adding to signs of a softening global picture that’s weighed on benchmark crude futures.

excerpt: International operators are lining up for new acreage across the MSGBC basin, with rising interest in The Gambia, Guinea-Bissau and deepwater frontier zones. As governments update fiscal terms and accelerate de-risking efforts, the region is positioning itself as West Africa’s next exploration hotspot.

excerpt: Crescent Energy has completed its all-stock acquisition of Vital Energy, creating a top-ten U.S. liquids-weighted independent E&P operator. The merger expands Crescent’s scale, strengthens free cash flow generation, and adds new board members as the company prepares 2026 guidance.

excerpt: Kongsberg Maritime has expanded its UUC PM azimuth thruster range with two new high-thrust models, boosting propulsion efficiency and flexibility for offshore and marine operations. The latest additions support larger vessels, reduce maintenance downtime, and strengthen lifecycle performance in demanding offshore energy environments.

excerpt: Buccaneer Energy is moving ahead with a new waterflood program at its Fouke area assets in Texas, aiming to double or triple recoverable volumes. The plan includes converting two wells for injection, reinstating production at Turner #1, and advancing development work over the next six months.

excerpt: KROHNE introduces enhancements in ultrasonic flow meter verification to improve custody transfer accuracy, reduce pumping costs, and ensure API-compliant performance in oil and gas operations.
title: KROHNE advances ultrasonic flow meter verification to boost custody transfer accuracy

excerpt: Nigeria is turning waste into opportunity by allowing 28 companies to capture and commercialize gas once lost to flaring, a move expected to draw billions in investment and boost energy output.

excerpt: API praised the House for passing bipartisan permitting reform bills that streamline pipeline reviews and federal approvals, calling it a key step toward faster, more efficient energy infrastructure development.
title: API praises House approval of bipartisan permitting reform bills

excerpt: Harbour Energy will acquire Waldorf Energy’s UK North Sea assets for $170 million, expanding its oil-weighted production and raising its stake in the Catcher field to 90%.
title: Harbour Energy expands North Sea footprint with $170 million Waldorf acquisition

excerpt: bp has started up the Atlantis Drill Center 1 expansion in the Gulf of America two months ahead of schedule, adding 15,000 boed and marking its seventh major project startup of 2025.`

excerpt: Chevron has tapped TechnipFMC to supply next-generation Subsea 2.0® production systems—including the first 7-inch subsea tree series—for the Gorgon Stage 3 expansion offshore Australia, reinforcing a two-decade partnership.

title: Chevron in talks with Trump team over Venezuela oil operations, sanctions

excerpt: Africa will need an estimated $375 billion in upstream and midstream investment over the next decade to develop its natural gas sector, according to the Society of Petroleum Engineers, as demand rises and infrastructure gaps persist.

excerpt: The U.S. Interior Department has restarted offshore oil and gas leasing, closing its first mandated Gulf lease sale under the One Big Beautiful Bill Act. The sale drew nearly $280 million in high bids, signaling renewed industry confidence and a shift toward expanded offshore development.

excerpt: TotalEnergies has signed an agreement with Galp to acquire a 40% operated interest in Namibia’s PEL 83 license, including the Mopane discovery, positioning the company as operator of the country’s two largest offshore oil finds and advancing plans for a future producing hub.

excerpt: McDermott has secured an EPCIC contract from PETRONAS Carigali Brunei for a major offshore gas development, covering subsea systems and a gas export pipeline that will support Brunei’s LNG sector.
title: McDermott awarded contract for major offshore gas development in Brunei

excerpt: Shell is reportedly seeking a partner for its Gato do Mato offshore oil project in Brazil as it looks to share the capital burden of a multibillion-dollar deepwater development. The move would allow Shell to remain operator while bringing in additional investment as the project advances toward first production later this decade.
title: Shell explores partner sale for Brazil offshore Gato do Mato oil project

excerpt: ExxonMobil has raised its 2030 outlook, projecting stronger upstream earnings and cash flow growth without increasing capital spending. The updated plan highlights accelerated production growth in the Permian, Guyana and LNG, deeper cost reductions, and earlier-than-expected emissions targets.
title: ExxonMobil raises 2030 plan, lifts upstream outlook without boosting capital

excerpt: Kistos has made its first move into the Middle East, agreeing to acquire onshore interests in Oman’s Blocks 9 and 3 & 4 in a $148-million deal with Mitsui. The transaction adds immediately cash-generative, liquids-weighted production and over 25 MMboe of net reserves.
title: Kistos expands beyond North Sea with $148-million Oman upstream deal

excerpt: EnerMech has secured a key pre-commissioning contract from Bechtel for Woodside’s Pluto LNG Train 2 project in Western Australia. The scope includes chemical cleaning of critical systems as the 5-MMtpa expansion prepares to move toward commissioning.
title: EnerMech wins pre-commissioning work for Woodside’s Pluto LNG Train 2

excerpt: IWCF has launched its new “Quality Assured” framework, providing independent endorsement for non-accredited well control training and aiming to strengthen consistency, competence and safety standards across the global oil and gas industry.
title: IWCF expands well control oversight with new Quality Assured training framework

excerpt: TotalEnergies will merge its UK Upstream business with NEO NEXT to create NEO NEXT+, a new entity set to become the UK’s largest independent oil and gas producer with more than 250,000 boed in 2026. The deal strengthens North Sea consolidation efforts and reinforces long-term energy security.
title: North Sea shakeup: TotalEnergies, NEO NEXT merge to form UK’s largest independent operator

excerpt: A Qatar-based offshore operator has selected Vissim to deploy a digital vessel collision avoidance system, enhancing real-time maritime monitoring and safety at an offshore field under a three-year technology agreement.
title: Qatar offshore operator taps Vissim for new vessel collision avoidance system

excerpt: Block Energy has received a non-binding farm-in offer from a major energy company for its Project III appraisal and early development program in Georgia. The proposal includes a full carry for well re-tests, sidetracks, and a 20 MMcf/d early-production facility.
title: Block Energy receives non-binding farm-in offer for major Georgia gas project

excerpt: Fluor and JGC have completed Train 2 at LNG Canada, marking the end of Phase 1 for the country’s first LNG megaproject and advancing a major new source of Canadian LNG to global markets.
title: LNG Canada reaches milestone as Fluor JV delivers second production train

excerpt: TechnipFMC secured a significant contract to design, manufacture and install flexible risers and flowlines for Ithaca Energy’s Captain field in the UK North Sea, advancing the field’s next phase of production growth.
title: TechnipFMC wins major subsea contract for Ithaca Energy’s Captain field

excerpt: Noble Corporation will sell six jackups in transactions totaling $424 million, exiting the standard jackup market as it shifts strategic focus toward deepwater and ultra-harsh-environment drilling.
title: Noble to divest six jackups in $424 million deal, sharpening deepwater focus

excerpt: Antero Resources has announced a major Marcellus expansion with a $2.8 billion acquisition of HG Energy’s upstream assets, paired with an $800 million divestiture of its Utica position. The deal reshapes the company’s portfolio heading into 2026 and sharply boosts its Appalachia production outlook.
title: Antero announces $2.8 billion Marcellus acquisition, Utica sale in strategic realignment

excerpt: Northern Oil and Gas and Infinity Natural Resources will jointly acquire premium Utica shale upstream and midstream assets for $1.2 billion, expanding NOG’s natural gas portfolio with long-life inventory, strong margins, and integrated infrastructure.
title: NOG expands Utica gas portfolio in $1.2 billion deal with Infinity

excerpt: Equinor and Aker BP have uncovered new gas and condensate volumes in Norway’s North Sea, with early estimates pointing to up to 113 million boe and tie-in potential to nearby infrastructure.
title: Equinor strikes gas in North Sea wildcat wells, opening new development potential

excerpt: Rystad Energy says digitalization could save oil and gas operators more than $320 billion in five years, as drilling optimization, robotics, predictive maintenance and new tech partnerships reshape the OFS sector.
title: Digitalization may unlock $320 billion in oil and gas savings by 2030, analysts say

excerpt: Eco Atlantic’s new strategic partnership with Navitas Petroleum adds fresh momentum to South Africa’s Orange basin, signaling renewed upstream interest and potential drilling acceleration across one of Africa’s most closely watched offshore frontiers.
title: Eco–Navitas alliance boosts South Africa’s Orange basin exploration momentum

excerpt: Chandler Engineering has introduced the 6700-M Mini Loop, a compact flow loop system engineered to deliver precise friction pressure testing for slickwater fracturing fluids, supporting laboratory and field optimization.
title: Chandler Engineering launches compact 6700-M Mini Flow Loop for friction testing

excerpt: PTTEP has approved a $33.3 billion five-year plan and a $7.7 billion budget for 2026, targeting production growth, accelerated global project development, and major decarbonization initiatives as Thailand works to strengthen long-term energy security.
title: PTTEP commits $33 billion through 2030 to advance Thailand’s energy strategy

excerpt: EIA and Macquarie offer starkly different views on 2026 oil and gas prices, with both warning of oversupply but diverging on how steep the decline may be.
title: Oversupply vs. stabilization: EIA and Macquarie split on 2026 energy price forecasts

excerpt: The American Petroleum Institute (API) is praising the Trump administration’s proposal to revise U.S. Corporate Average Fuel Economy (CAFE) standards, arguing the move will preserve consumer choice and support stable domestic energy demand.
title: API backs Trump administration plan to revise fuel-economy standards

excerpt: Halliburton has promoted Shannon Slocum to executive vice president and COO, expanding his leadership role over global operations, technology, HSE and business development. The company also announced Rami Yassine as the new president of the Eastern Hemisphere.
title: Halliburton names new EVP, COO, advancing global operations strategy

excerpt: Kongsberg Maritime has landed a major LARS contract with Sea1 Offshore, supplying advanced launch-and-recovery systems for four new construction vessels and boosting subsea capability in harsh offshore conditions.
title: Kongsberg Maritime wins LARS package for Sea1 Offshore construction vessels

excerpt: Saudi Aramco has slashed its Arab Light crude price to the lowest level since 2021, signaling mounting global oversupply and softer demand as OPEC+ prepares for a slower start to 2026.
title: Saudi crude prices fall sharply as OPEC+ holds output pause into 2026

excerpt: Chevron has unveiled a 2026 capex budget of $18–$19 billion, with major spending directed toward U.S. shale, offshore growth in Guyana and the Gulf, and lower-carbon investments.
title: Chevron sets 2026 capex at $18–$19 billion, prioritizes high-return upstream growth

excerpt: Congo is accelerating its upstream expansion, ramping LNG output and boosting oil production toward 500,000 bpd. New projects, fast-paced LNG development and pro-investment reforms are positioning the country as a rising hub in Central Africa’s energy future.
title: Congo accelerates upstream expansion as LNG Phase 2 comes online

excerpt: Chevron is continuing routine flights to Venezuelan oil sites despite U.S. airspace warning, with the company stressing full regulatory compliance and prioritizing worker safety amid heightened regional navigation risks.
title: Chevron continues Venezuela oil site flights despite FAA airspace warning

excerpt: ReconAfrica has encountered 64 m of hydrocarbon pay at its Kavango West 1X well in Namibia’s onshore PEL 73. The company will conduct a production test in early 2026 to evaluate flow potential and advance the emerging Damara Fold Belt play.
title: Hydrocarbon discovery strengthens Namibia’s onshore potential at Kavango West 1X well

excerpt: Aramco has started gas production from the first phase of its Jafurah shale project, delivering 450 MMcfd as the company targets 2 Bcfd and major unconventional growth.
title: Aramco begins gas production at Jafurah, world’s largest shale project outside U.S.

excerpt: Black Stone Minerals and Caturus Energy have entered a 220,000-acre Haynesville development agreement, establishing a multi-year drilling program to expand Gulf Coast natural gas output.
title: BSM, Caturus advance Haynesville expansion with multi-year drilling pact

excerpt: Op-Ed: Africa’s emerging gas hubs could reshape the continent’s energy and economic future. NJ Ayuk outlines how upstream growth, infrastructure expansion and balanced fiscal policies can unlock transformational benefits—if nations navigate key risks.
title: Op-Ed: Why Africa’s gas boom could reshape the continent’s energy future

excerpt: The National Petroleum Council has issued two major reports urging urgent federal permitting reform and tighter gas-electric coordination to safeguard U.S. energy reliability as demand surges. DOE Secretary Chris Wright welcomed the recommendations.
title: Permitting bottlenecks threaten energy security, NPC tells U.S. Department of Energy

excerpt: Crescent Energy has sold its non-operated DJ basin assets for $90 million, marking more than $900 million in executed non-core divestitures year-to-date. Proceeds will reduce debt and strengthen the company’s balance sheet as it continues to streamline its portfolio.
title: Crescent advances $900 million non-core divestiture program with DJ basin sale

excerpt: TotalEnergies has pulled ahead as the top bidder for Galp’s 40% stake in the giant Mopane oil discovery offshore Namibia. The acquisition would strengthen TotalEnergies’ position in the Orange basin, as Galp seeks a partner to advance one of the decade’s largest finds.
title: TotalEnergies emerges as top bidder for Galp’s Namibia Mopane oil stake

excerpt: Wood’s Massy Wood JV has secured the brownfield EPC contract for bpTT’s Ginger gas development, advancing critical upgrades on the Juniper platform. The scope includes corrosion-protection enhancements and new methanol injection systems.
title: Wood JV wins EPC contract for bpTT’s Ginger gas project

excerpt: Halliburton has appointed veteran oil and gas executive Timothy A. Leach to its board of directors, effective Dec. 2, 2025, adding one of the U.S. shale sector’s most recognizable leaders to the company’s governance team. Leach will stand for election at Halliburton’s 2026 annual shareholders meeting.
title: Halliburton appoints longtime shale executive Tim Leach to board

excerpt: ABL and Petroleum Marine Services have partnered to launch a unified rig-moving service covering the Red Sea and Gulf of Suez—aimed at cutting downtime, strengthening safety and bringing global-standard execution to one of the region’s busiest offshore basins.
title: ABL, PMS launch unified rig-moving service to boost offshore efficiency in Egypt

excerpt: Nokia and Tampnet are bringing next-generation 5G connectivity to the U.S. Gulf, upgrading offshore networks that support hundreds of platforms and vessels. The initiative marks a major step toward safer, more automated offshore operations.
title: Nokia, Tampnet to expand 5G offshore connectivity across U.S. Gulf

excerpt: Unseenlabs has successfully launched its BRO-17 and BRO-20 satellites—an expansion that strengthens global RF-detection capabilities increasingly used to monitor offshore energy activity.
title: New Unseenlabs satellites boost RF detection for global offshore energy security

excerpt: Africa’s upstream sector is gaining investor momentum, with regulatory reforms, new licensing rounds, and gas-focused policies improving above-ground attractiveness across key markets from Angola to Namibia and Nigeria.
title: Upstream reforms across Africa support rising E&P spending through 2026

excerpt: Acteon’s InterMoor has landed a three-year Petrobras contract to deliver advanced mooring integrity and digital inspection services across Brazil, strengthening lifecycle management for critical offshore infrastructure.
title: Petrobras taps Acteon for long-term mooring inspection and QA program

excerpt: Argentina has reached its first long-term LNG sales agreement, marking a pivotal moment for Vaca Muerta’s gas ambitions. A producer consortium led by Pan American Energy will supply up to 2 MMtpa to Germany’s SEFE beginning in 2027.
title: Vaca Muerta boom drives Argentina’s first long-term LNG export agreement

excerpt: Iraq is moving to reshape ownership of the giant West Qurna-2 field, launching direct talks with select U.S. oil companies to acquire Lukoil’s sanctioned stake. Baghdad says a U.S. operator would strengthen market stability and deepen energy ties with Washington.
title: Iraq targets U.S. firms for West Qurna-2 stake transfer as sanctions pressure Lukoil

excerpt: Harbour Energy will cut 100 more UK jobs after the government retained the Energy Profits Levy through 2030. The operator says North Sea assets are struggling to attract capital under the 78% tax burden, following earlier workforce reductions.
title: Harbour Energy to cut 100 UK offshore jobs as windfall tax extension squeezes investment

excerpt: Kenya has cleared a major hurdle for long-delayed oil development in the South Lokichar basin, granting Gulf Energy broad tax exemptions and higher cost-recovery terms after acquiring Tullow’s former assets.
title: Kenya grants major tax incentives to advance South Lokichar oil development

excerpt: TotalEnergies has expanded its global exploration partnership with Chevron through a farmout agreement transferring a 40% stake in Nigeria’s offshore PPL 2000 and 2001 licenses. The joint venture strengthens both companies’ positions in the West Delta basin as regulatory approvals progress.
title: Chevron takes 40% stake in TotalEnergies’ offshore Nigeria blocks

excerpt: Perenco has completed a 12-well drilling campaign at Chad’s Badila field, adding horizontal, appraisal and water-disposal wells and boosting combined Badila–Mangara production to over 18,000 bopd. The rig has now moved to the Doba Basin for the next phase of development.
title: Perenco completes 12-well drilling campaign at Chad’s Badila field

excerpt: Subsea Supplies has partnered with DRIFT Offshore to expand subsea connector and cable assembly support for U.S. energy operators. The collaboration establishes local manufacturing and testing capabilities in Florida, reducing lead times and improving supply-chain reliability for offshore projects.
title: New partnership enhances subsea equipment availability for U.S. offshore sector

excerpt: Petrobras reduced its five-year investment plan to $109 billion, citing weaker oil prices and shifting political pressures. The cut raises investor concerns over dividend yields as the Brazilian state-controlled producer prioritizes long-term offshore expansion.
title: Petrobras trims $109 billion capex plan as lower oil prices pressure dividends

excerpt: Aker Solutions has landed a substantial six-year ConocoPhillips contract for maintenance and modification work on Norway’s Eldfisk and Ekofisk fields—extending one of the largest brownfield portfolios on the NCS.
title: ConocoPhillips awards Aker Solutions substantial six-year M&M deal on NCS

excerpt: Ecopetrol has approved a 2026 investment plan of $5.4–$6.6 billion, keeping spending steady as the company targets 730,000–740,000 boed next year. The plan prioritizes upstream activity, refinery reliability and gas development, while allocating 30% to energy-transition, transmission and infrastructure projects under a conservative $60 Brent outlook.
title: Ecopetrol to drill up to 430 wells under 2026 investment plan as upstream remains priority

excerpt: Komo Ressources Group has achieved first oil at the Autour field, becoming the first privately held Gabonese operator to bring a new field onstream. The project, located onshore Gabon, reached initial production on Nov. 27, 2025.
title: KOREG brings Autour field online, marking first oil for a Gabonese private operator

excerpt: OPEC+ confirmed it will pause planned output hikes in early 2026, citing weakening demand and a looming global surplus. The alliance also advanced a sensitive review of member production capacities—an issue that could reshape quotas heading into 2027.
title: OPEC+ confirms plan to pause production hikes in early 2026 amid surplus concerns

excerpt: EPA has finalized a rule extending compliance deadlines for methane-leak detection and equipment upgrades, giving U.S. oil and gas operators more than a year of additional time to meet federal requirements—drawing praise from industry and criticism from environmental groups.
title: Oil and gas firms get more time under EPA’s revised methane rule

excerpt: Angola has officially launched a $4 billion gas processing plant at Soyo—its first designed to handle standalone gas fields—marking a major shift in the country’s upstream strategy.
title: Angola starts up $4 billion gas facility to advance energy security, gas monetization

excerpt: Petralon Energy is accelerating drilling at Nigeria’s Dawes Island field, bringing DI-2 online and spudding DI-3 under the PIA’s “Drill or Drop” mandate. Backed by strong government endorsement, the project highlights the growing role of indigenous operators in boosting national production and advancing Nigeria’s upstream goals.
title: Nigeria strengthens upstream output as Petralon Energy expands Dawes Island drilling

excerpt: OPEC+ is expected to confirm its plan to pause production hikes in early 2026 amid mounting signs of a supply surplus and softer oil prices. Ministers meet Sunday to finalize the already-agreed policy while also reviewing long-term capacity levels across the alliance.
title: OPEC+ set to pause production increases in 2026 as global surplus builds

excerpt: Colombia’s election authority has fined Ecopetrol CEO Ricardo Roa and other officials from President Gustavo Petro’s 2022 campaign for exceeding spending limits, adding new scrutiny as prosecutors pursue parallel investigations into campaign financing.
title: Colombia fines Ecopetrol CEO Ricardo Roa over Petro campaign spending violations

excerpt: The UK will keep its North Sea windfall tax in place until 2030, according to the Office for Budget Responsibility, despite industry warnings that the levy is accelerating production declines, deterring investment, and threatening thousands of offshore jobs.
title: Windfall tax stays: UK decision alarms North Sea oil and gas producers

excerpt: ADNOC Gas has signed a landmark 20-year, up to $4.2 billion natural gas supply agreement with EMSTEEL, securing long-term feedstock for one of the UAE’s largest industrial producers and reinforcing the company’s role in powering the nation’s manufacturing and economic growth.
title: ADNOC Gas seals $4 billion, 20-year natural gas supply deal with EMSTEEL

excerpt: Carlyle Group’s Jeff Currie says the massive surge in AI-related capital spending mirrors the shale industry’s pre-crash “growth at all costs” era, warning that Big Tech’s datacenter and chip investment boom is following the same debt-heavy playbook that once wiped out trillions in oil and gas equity.
title: AI spending boom mirrors early shale-era ‘growth at all costs,’  says Carlyle Group

excerpt: The UK government’s decision to maintain the Energy Profits Levy (EPL) at a 78% headline tax rate continues to cloud investment planning for North Sea operators, according to Alan Stewart, Aberdeen-based partner at accountancy and advisory firm MHA.
title: Industry reacts to UK’s decision to retain Energy Profits Levy, warns of investment uncertainty

excerpt: PipeSense has signed an exclusive agreement with Indigenous-owned Monitor Emissions to expand advanced leak detection, pig tracking, and hydrotesting technologies across Canada’s pipeline network—strengthening national integrity, safety and emissions reduction efforts.
title: New Canada-wide agreement boosts leak detection capabilities for oil and gas pipelines

excerpt: Brazil’s environment minister says COP30’s push for a global fossil-fuel phaseout stalled partly because the U.S. skipped the summit—deepening political divides and weakening momentum behind a fossil-fuel road map.
title: Brazil’s Silva says U.S. absence weakened COP30 push to phase down fossil fuels

excerpt: Brazil’s Petrobras is likely to postpone awarding up to four drillship contracts for its giant Buzios field until 2026, as the operator reassesses reservoir data and contractors revise bids amid a soft offshore rig market and emerging global oil glut.
title: Petrobras expected to delay Buzios drilling contracts into 2026 amid global rig slowdown

excerpt: Seatrium has secured its second deepwater FPU contract from bp, winning the Tiber project in the U.S. Gulf. Leveraging a series-build approach and lessons from the Kaskida unit, the Tiber FPU will deliver 80,000 bpd from Keathley Canyon using fully integrated, single-lift topsides.
title: bp taps Seatrium for Tiber FPU, expanding deepwater project portfolio

excerpt: DeepOcean is nearing completion of a fully diverless disconnection of TotalEnergies’ Gryphon Alpha FPSO—an industry first enabled by proprietary subsea tooling and a major milestone in North Sea decommissioning.
title: DeepOcean delivers fully diverless Gryphon Alpha FPSO removal for TotalEnergies

excerpt: Woodside Energy has signed a suite of global frame agreements with ABL to deliver marine warranty, assurance, and consultancy services across its offshore operations in Australia, the U.S. and other international regions.
title: Woodside signs five-year frame agreements with ABL for offshore support

excerpt: A new survey shows UK offshore and underwater supply chain firms are weighing moves overseas as oil, gas and wind projects face mounting delays. Industry leaders warn that stalled timelines and policy uncertainty are eroding competitiveness and risking long-term capacity.
title: Survey warns UK offshore energy supply chain may shift overseas amid project delays

excerpt: TotalEnergies has finalized the sale of its 12.5% non-operated interest in Nigeria’s deepwater Bonga field (OML 118 PSC) to Shell Nigeria Exploration and Production Company and Nigerian Agip Exploration for a combined $510 million, marking a major portfolio shift in one of its key hydrocarbon regions.
title: TotalEnergies completes divestment of 12.5% Bonga field stake in Nigeria for $510 million

excerpt: Equinor is ramping up offshore activity next year with 26 planned exploration and appraisal wells across the North Sea, Norwegian Sea and Barents Sea—part of a decade-long push to keep Norwegian production strong.
title: Equinor to drill 26 exploration and appraisal wells offshore Norway in 2026

excerpt: A new drilling surge is underway in the U.S. Gulf, as Beacon Offshore starts up record-setting high-pressure wells that could reshape long-term U.S. deepwater production.
title: U.S. Gulf output set to rise as Beacon Offshore brings historic wells online

excerpt: Condor Energies has reached TD on its first horizontal well in Uzbekistan’s Andakli field while two new Jurassic clastics workovers lifted production to nearly 12,000 boed. Early results point to a scalable new gas play as the company prepares for an expanded drilling program in 2026.
title: Condor Energies advances Uzbekistan drilling campaign as first horizontal well reaches TD

excerpt: Suriname has opened 60% of its offshore acreage through a new Open-Door Offering aimed at accelerating exploration in the Guiana basin. The program includes flexible licensing options, competitive fiscal terms, and a new GeoPortal providing discounted access to seismic data.
title: Suriname offers 60% of offshore acreage to accelerate Guiana basin oil exploration

excerpt: Abu Dhabi’s ADNOC will maintain its $150 billion spending plan over the next five years as the company ramps up oil and gas capacity and accelerates global expansion through its fast-growing XRG investment arm.
title: ADNOC reaffirms $150 billion plan to boost upstream capacity, international expansion

excerpt: Diversified Energy has closed its $550 million acquisition of Canvas Energy, adding roughly 24,000 boed of production and expanding its acreage position in Oklahoma. The $550 million deal includes operated producing assets and approximately 1.6 million net acres across the state.
title: Diversified completes $550 million Canvas Energy acquisition, boosting Oklahoma production

excerpt: African leaders are calling on the G20 to prioritize investment in the continent’s oil and gas resources, arguing that expanded upstream development is essential for industrial growth, energy security and lifting millions out of energy poverty.
title: Africa urges G20 to back oil and gas development to drive industrial growth

excerpt: FairWind has signed a strategic partnership with Japan’s Wind Energy Partners (WEP), accelerating its Asia Pacific expansion and enhancing onshore and offshore wind turbine installation and maintenance capabilities.
title: FairWind expands Asia-Pacific footprint with new Japan partnership

excerpt: bp’s Greater Tortue Ahmeyim (GTA) Phase 1 LNG development offshore Mauritania and Senegal has been awarded both the Engineering, Construction & Infrastructure Project of the Year and Overall Project of the Year at the 2025 APM Project Management Awards.
title: bp’s deepwater GTA LNG development earns dual APM Project Awards

excerpt: Tullow Oil shares collapsed to a record low after the company signaled it may pursue alternative refinancing measures to address upcoming debt maturities. With net debt now expected to reach $1.2 billion, analysts warn that a debt-for-equity swap could severely dilute existing shareholders.
title: Tullow Oil shares hit record lows as refinancing fears deepen

excerpt: The U.S. Department of Energy has eliminated key clean-energy and renewable offices as part of a broad Trump administration reorganization, replacing them with new divisions focused on hydrocarbons, geothermal development, and fusion. The shift underscores a major policy pivot toward expanding domestic oil and gas production.
title: Trump administration restructures DOE, dropping clean-energy offices in favor of hydrocarbons

excerpt: Brazil is preparing a COP30 draft agreement that’s expected to omit any fossil fuel transition road map, setting up a major clash with more than 80 nations pushing for clearer commitments to move away from oil and gas.
title: Tensions rise at COP30 as Brazil’s draft avoids fossil fuel phase-out language

excerpt: UK energy leaders Sir Ian Wood and Martin Gilbert are sounding the alarm on North Sea investment, warning that the windfall tax is accelerating job losses and undermining the region’s world-class offshore talent.
title: North Sea at risk unless UK ends windfall tax, industry veterans warn

excerpt: D-Tech has fully commercialized its OmniSteer rotary steerable platform after exceeding one million feet drilled across global basins. The latest generation RSS integrates upgraded digital controls, automated steering algorithms, and a streamlined mechanical design.
title: D-Tech commercializes OmniSteer RSS after topping one million feet drilled

excerpt: South Africa is accelerating domestic gas development and LNG import capacity as declining supplies from Mozambique loom. Minister Gwede Mantashe outlined fast-track plans for the Matola and Richards Bay LNG projects and regulatory reforms to unlock offshore exploration.
title: South Africa moves to unlock offshore gas, boost energy resilience

excerpt: Russia’s Lukoil PJSC has dissolved the supervisory board of its international business as U.S. sanctions take effect, signaling deepening operational and financial strain for the oil producer. The move comes as global buyers examine Lukoil’s overseas assets and trading operations contract under mounting pressure.
title: Lukoil shutters international board amid escalating U.S. sanctions

excerpt: Altera Infrastructure says Aberdeen’s deep offshore expertise is driving rapid progress at Ivory Coast’s Baleine field, where the Petrojarl Kong FPSO reached first oil in just 24 months and now supports growing local content and lower-emission operations.
title: Aberdeen expertise drives Altera’s fast-track offshore success in Ivory Coast

excerpt: Baker Hughes has secured a major order for 25 aeroderivative gas turbines from Dynamis Power Solutions, supporting a new high-capacity mobile power system designed for upstream, refining and petrochemical operations across North America.
title: Baker Hughes secures major turbine order to power mobile oil and gas operations

excerpt: TotalEnergies has formally rejected allegations linking its Mozambique LNG project to violence reported in 2021, citing early site evacuation and ongoing official investigations into the claims.
title: TotalEnergies reaffirms stance on security, human rights amid Mozambique allegations

excerpt: ExxonMobil has lifted force majeure on its Rovuma LNG project in Mozambique, clearing the way for work to resume and bringing the long-delayed development closer to FID as regional security improves.
title: Exxon lifts force majeure on Rovuma LNG, clearing path for major Mozambique gas development

excerpt: HKN Energy and Iraq’s Ministry of Oil have finalized technical terms for the Hamrin oil field, advancing the project toward a full contract and future production growth.
title: HKN Energy, Iraq finalize technical terms for Hamrin oil field development

excerpt: The U.S. Department of the Interior has proposed its most expansive offshore leasing plan in years—up to 34 OCS lease sales across the Gulf of America, Alaska and the Pacific. API, NOIA and IPAA call it a “historic step” toward restoring U.S. offshore competitiveness and strengthening long-term energy security.
title: Industry applauds ‘historic’ U.S. offshore leasing proposal as energy demand rises

excerpt: EnerMech has secured a one-year extension to maintain cranes and deliver integrity services across six offshore assets—including multiple FPSOs—in North West Australia, strengthening a partnership that dates back to 2019.
title: EnerMech wins one-year extension for offshore crane maintenance in Australia

excerpt: BW Energy’s Kharas-1 appraisal well has confirmed the first liquid hydrocarbons in Namibia’s offshore Kudu block, delivering key subsurface data and shaping the operator’s next appraisal steps.
title: BW Energy confirms hydrocarbons in Kudu appraisal well offshore Namibia

excerpt: Pakistan Petroleum Ltd. is constructing an offshore artificial island in the Arabian Sea to support continuous oil and gas exploration. The island—located 30 km off Sindh’s coast—will enable round-the-clock drilling operations as Pakistan accelerates its offshore program following renewed interest in its resource potential.
title: Pakistan to build offshore artificial island to accelerate oil and gas exploration

excerpt: New Xodus research estimates Australia’s full offshore oil and gas decommissioning liability at $43.6 billion—down from 2020 projections—reflecting rising efficiency and improved cost forecasting.
title: New analysis lowers Australia’s projected offshore decommissioning costs to $43.6 billion

excerpt: DeepOcean has won a UK North Sea subsea tie-back contract involving riser, flowline and umbilical installation, with engineering led from Aberdeen and offshore work set in two phases.
title: DeepOcean awarded North Sea subsea construction and tie-in scope

excerpt: Alaska oil output is set for its biggest annual jump since the 1980s. New EIA data show North Slope production climbing 13% in 2026, driven by fast-ramping barrels from ConocoPhillips’ Nuna project and Santos/Repsol’s Pikka Phase 1 development.
title: Alaska oil production set for biggest jump in decades, EIA says

excerpt: Chevron CEO Mike Wirth signaled the company’s long-term commitment to Venezuela’s vast oil reserves, saying the major sees a future role in helping rebuild the nation’s energy economy once political conditions allow—even as U.S. pressure on the Maduro regime intensifies.
title: Chevron CEO affirms long-term presence in Venezuela as political pressure grows

excerpt: Transocean has picked up $89 million in new backlog after operators in Brazil, Norway and Romania exercised options on three of its floating rigs, underscoring steady demand for ultra-deepwater and harsh-environment capacity.
title: Transocean adds $89 million in new offshore drilling options across three regions

excerpt: DNO has reshaped its North Sea portfolio by divesting its Ekofisk PPF stake and acquiring new interests in the Verdande field and Cassio prospect, advancing a strategy focused on near-term cash flow and quick-cycle development.
title: DNO strengthens near-term North Sea production with new Verdande, Cassio acreage

excerpt: SLB OneSubsea has secured an EPC contract to deliver a standardized subsea boosting system for bp’s Tiber project in the deepwater Gulf of Mexico—the second such award tied to bp’s Paleogene developments after Kaskida.
title: SLB OneSubsea wins second bp subsea boosting award following Kaskida project

excerpt: TechnipFMC has landed a substantial iEPCI™ contract for Eni’s Maha deepwater project offshore Indonesia—the first use of Subsea 2.0® technology in the country and a new tieback to the Jangkrik FPU.
title: Eni awards TechnipFMC substantial iEPCI™ scope for Maha project offshore Indonesia

excerpt: Turkey’s state energy company TPAO plans to issue as much as $4 billion in Islamic debt to accelerate oil and gas production growth, including Black Sea gas expansion and Southeast Turkey unconventional development. The debut sukuk will also support international projects in Libya, Oman, Pakistan and more.
title: Turkey's TPAO targets $4 billion debt issuance to accelerate oil and gas production

excerpt: The U.S. Treasury says its latest sanctions on Rosneft and Lukoil are pushing Russian crude prices to multi-year lows and prompting major Indian and Chinese buyers to pause December purchases. Officials warn additional measures may follow as the U.S. targets Moscow’s oil revenue.
title: U.S. says new sanctions are driving Russian oil prices to multi-year lows

excerpt: At the Wider African Energy Summit in Aberdeen, operators and industry groups highlighted how UK offshore engineering and project-delivery expertise could help African nations accelerate upstream growth, strengthen gas monetization and improve emissions performance.
title: UK offshore expertise spotlighted as African producers pursue faster oil and gas development

excerpt: ExxonMobil, Chevron, ADNOC and Carlyle are evaluating parts of Lukoil’s international portfolio as U.S. sanctions set to take effect in December accelerate the Russian producer’s efforts to divest global assets, including stakes in Iraq’s West Qurna 2 field and operations in Uzbekistan.
title: Exxon, Chevron and ADNOC explore bids for Lukoil’s international assets

excerpt: TGS has kicked off its Pelotas Norte Phase I 3D multi-client survey offshore southern Brazil, covering 14,800 km² of largely unheld acreage ahead of upcoming bid rounds. A Ramform Titan-class vessel using GeoStreamer® technology will acquire data through Q3 2026.
title: TGS accelerates Brazil exploration imaging with Pelotas Norte Phase I survey

excerpt: TotalEnergies has signed a €5.1 billion all-stock agreement to acquire a 50% stake in EPH’s flexible power generation platform, marking one of the company’s most significant moves yet to scale its gas-to-power integration strategy across Europe.
title: TotalEnergies accelerates gas-to-power strategy with $5.5 billion EPH deal

excerpt: Petrobras has confirmed a new post-salt oil discovery in Brazil’s Campos basin, identifying high-quality crude at the Sudoeste de Tartaruga Verde block. The well has been drilled and logged, with lab analysis now underway to assess full reservoir potential.
title: Petrobras confirms new post-salt oil discovery in Brazil’s Campos basin

excerpt: Nexans has launched the hull of the CLV Electra at Ulstein Verft, marking a major step toward commissioning one of the industry’s most advanced subsea cable-laying vessels. Designed for high-voltage offshore wind and interconnector projects, Electra will begin sea trials in spring 2026.
title: Nexans launches ‘Electra’ cable-laying vessel at Ulstein Verft, advancing offshore electrification

excerpt: The American Petroleum Institute has launched a nationwide campaign spotlighting the skill, safety, and professionalism of U.S. oil and gas workers, tying into renewed public interest with the return of the Paramount+ series Landman.
title: API launches national campaign highlighting U.S. oil and gas workforce as “Landman” returns

excerpt: A 40,000-bopd FPSO with 1.1 MMbbl storage—Tamara Tokoni—is now available offshore West Africa for rapid redeployment. The unit offers operators a near-term option to accelerate field development timelines with existing topsides capacity and flexible mooring configurations.
title: FPSO Tamara Tokoni offered for redeployment to support fast-track West Africa projects

excerpt: Canada’s oil sands are seeing renewed growth as U.S. shale output plateaus, with production hitting record highs following the Trans Mountain pipeline expansion. Improved heavy-oil pricing and rising U.S. investor interest are driving a resurgence among major oil sands producers through 2030.
title: Canada’s oil sands surge as U.S. shale growth plateaus

excerpt: ADNOC has secured conditional EU approval for its $13.9 billion acquisition of Covestro after offering commitments to address subsidy and competition concerns. The deal advances ADNOC's global chemicals and materials strategy while opening Covestro patents to European market participants for the next decade.
title: ADNOC's $13.9 billion Covestro acquisition secures conditional EU approval

excerpt: TotalEnergies has committed $100 million to Climate Investment’s venture strategy fund, a move aimed at accelerating the deployment of methane-reduction, carbon capture and energy-efficiency technologies across the global oil and gas sector.
title: TotalEnergies invests $100 million to scale upstream decarbonization technologies

excerpt: Frontera Energy Corp. plans to separate its Colombian infrastructure assets into a new independent company—Frontera Infrastructure—leaving Frontera Exploration & Production (E&P) as a focused, pure-play upstream operator.
title: Frontera to create standalone upstream company through Colombian infrastructure spin-off

excerpt: S&P Global has reintroduced its Commodity Insights division under a new name—S&P Global Energy—as the company moves to strengthen its role as a leading provider of energy market benchmarks, data and analytics.
title: S&P Global rebrands Commodity Insights as S&P Global Energy to sharpen focus on global energy intelligence

excerpt: The Trump administration has finalized its rollback of drilling restrictions across the 23 million-acre National Petroleum Reserve–Alaska, reopening vast Arctic areas with an estimated 8.7 billion barrels of resources.
title: Trump finalizes rollback of Arctic drilling restrictions

excerpt: K2 Energy Group has acquired Eutex’s global hazardous-area inspection services division, strengthening its offshore and drilling-sector compliance capabilities. The deal integrates Eutex’s inspection expertise with K2’s technology-led maintenance and engineering services, enhancing safety support for major operators worldwide.
title: K2 Energy Group strengthens offshore compliance services through Eutex acquisition

excerpt: Colombia’s tax authority has ruled out freezing Ecopetrol’s assets amid a $3 billion VAT dispute tied to fuel imports. The state oil producer says it sees strong chances of overturning the claim, as shares rose on stronger-than-expected Q3 earnings.
title: Ecopetrol avoids asset freeze as $3 billion VAT dispute advances in Colombia

excerpt: ADNOC Gas reported the strongest third-quarter results in its history, delivering $1.34 billion in net income—an 8% year-over-year increase—driven by robust domestic gas demand and improved commercial terms. Year-to-date profit reached $3.99 billion, up 10% from 2024, despite lower average oil prices.
title: ADNOC Gas posts record Q3 profit on rising UAE gas demand, improved margins

excerpt: Repsol is evaluating a reverse merger between its $19 billion upstream division and APA to speed a New York listing, as the company weighs options ranging from an IPO to a stake sale.
title: Repsol’s $19 billion upstream arm could merge with APA in bid to accelerate U.S. listing

excerpt: The IEA says new U.S. sanctions on Rosneft and Lukoil pose major downside risks to Russia’s oil output and global supply, despite exports holding steady for now.
title: IEA flags significant threats to Russian oil production under tougher U.S. sanctions

excerpt: Chevron CEO Mike Wirth says rising OPEC+ supply will pressure oil prices in 2026, while global LNG demand remains strong despite a supply surge later in the decade.
title: Chevron forecasts tighter pressure on oil than LNG in 2026 as global supply ramps up

excerpt: DeepOcean has secured a subsea construction and installation contract from Equinor for the Snorre Export and Import Gas Project (SNEIG), part of the broader effort to extend the Snorre field’s production life beyond 2040.
title: Equinor taps DeepOcean for subsea installation work on Snorre gas expansion

excerpt: Cenovus has officially closed its acquisition of MEG Energy, adding 110,000 bpd of low-cost oil sands production and consolidating a key thermal hub in Alberta. The deal strengthens Cenovus’s long-life asset base and positions the company for new synergies ahead of its 2026 budget update.
title: Cenovus completes MEG acquisition, adding 110,000 bopd of oil sands output

excerpt: Chevron has chosen West Texas as the site of its first natural gas-fired power project supplying energy directly to a data center, marking its entry into the fast-growing AI infrastructure sector.
title: Chevron selects West Texas for first AI data center power project

excerpt: In a new op-ed, African Energy Chamber Chairman NJ Ayuk emphasizes that responsible oil and gas production is essential for Africa’s economic growth, energy security, and poverty reduction, despite mounting global pressure to curb exploration.
title: Africa won’t give up its oil and gas — and shouldn’t, argues AEC chief

excerpt: Vista Energy plans to nearly double shale output in Argentina by 2030 as President Javier Milei advances sweeping reforms to boost investment and competitiveness in the Vaca Muerta basin. CEO Miguel Galuccio said tax and labor changes could unlock major gains for Argentina’s growing shale sector.
title: Vista targets shale production surge as Argentina’s Milei advances energy reforms

excerpt: Unique Group is partnering with DEEP to deliver key engineering and life-support systems for Vanguard, the world’s first DNV-classed subsea habitat. Vanguard will enable scientists to live and work underwater for up to a week, marking a major step forward in offshore research.
title: Unique Group, DEEP unveil next-gen subsea habitat for ocean research

excerpt: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency has approved Texas’ application for primacy over Class VI injection wells, transferring regulatory authority to the Railroad Commission of Texas. The move, supported by the Trump administration, streamlines permitting for carbon capture and storage (CCS) projects.
title: Trump Administration grants Texas primacy over Class VI CO₂ storage wells

excerpt: TGS and Viridien have released early “Laconia Phase III” ocean bottom node (OBN) results revealing sharper imaging and reduced exploration risk across key Paleogene targets in the U.S. Gulf. The data comes just weeks before U.S. Lease Sale 262 (BBG 1) on Dec. 10, giving explorers new subsurface insight as they finalize bidding strategies.
title: TGS, Viridien seismic results give U.S. Gulf exploration edge before December lease sale

excerpt: Namibia is moving to bring its oil and gas sector under presidential control as it prepares to join the ranks of Africa’s oil producers. The proposed reform follows major offshore discoveries by TotalEnergies, Shell and Galp, marking a new phase in Namibia’s energy governance and exploration growth.
title: Namibia moves to centralize oil and gas oversight under presidency

excerpt: Governments across Europe and the Middle East are scrambling to maintain operations at Lukoil’s global oil assets after the U.S. Treasury sanctioned Russia’s number two oil producer and blocked a proposed sale to Gunvor Group.
title: Governments race to secure Lukoil assets as U.S. sanctions deadline nears

excerpt: TotalEnergies has signed a production sharing contract with QatarEnergy and Petronas for Block S4 offshore Guyana, becoming operator of the 1,788 km² shallow-water block. The partnership marks TotalEnergies’ entry as an operator in Guyana and supports its strategy to explore low-cost, low-emission resources in a prolific hydrocarbon basin.
title: TotalEnergies takes operatorship of new offshore Guyana exploration block

excerpt: Kenya’s Gulf Energy plans to start oil production from the former Tullow Oil fields in the South Lokichar basin by December 2026, following government approval of its field development plan. The $120 million acquisition marks a major step toward Kenya’s first commercial oil output.
title: Kenya’s Gulf Energy targets first oil from former Tullow fields by end-2026

excerpt: ADNOC Logistics & Services reported record nine-month 2025 results with revenue up 39% and net profit up 9% year-on-year, supported by strong Q3 performance and growth across all business lines. The company raised its full-year dividend 20%, secured major contracts, and advanced digital and fleet expansion initiatives.
title: ADNOC L&S posts record nine-month 2025 results as Q3 profit jumps 20% year-on-year

excerpt: North Dakota’s Industrial Commission has awarded $45.1 million in matching grants to advance Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR) projects in the Williston basin. The funding supports pilots by Chord Energy, Continental Resources, Devon, Cobra, and the EERC to boost recovery and extend field life for decades.
title: North Dakota backs $45 million in EOR research to extend Williston basin production

excerpt: VAALCO Energy is advancing major operational projects across Africa, including a late-2025 drilling campaign in Gabon, the Baobab FPSO refurbishment in Côte d’Ivoire, and new well completions in Egypt. The company also continues progress on the Venus development offshore Equatorial Guinea.
title: VAALCO Energy advances drilling, FPSO and maintenance programs across Africa

excerpt: Anasuria Operating Company has selected MODS Connect WorkPack and MODS Connect Completions under a new 12-month contract to digitalize project execution and completions across its UK North Sea assets.
title: North Sea operators advance project delivery with intelligent completions technology

excerpt: Glenfarne Alaska LNG and Baker Hughes have signed definitive agreements to advance the Alaska LNG Project, with Baker Hughes providing key compression and power equipment and making a strategic investment in the development.
title: Baker Hughes invests in Alaska LNG, supplying key equipment for U.S. mega-project

excerpt: TMC Compressors has been awarded a contract by MODEC to supply a marine compressed air system for the Gato do Mato FPSO offshore Brazil, part of the Shell-operated Orca Project, which will produce 120,000 bopd in 2,000 meters of water.
title: MODEC awards TMC major compressor contract for Brazil-bound FPSO project

excerpt: ExxonMobil CEO Darren Woods says the company will move “fairly quickly” on the Mozambique Rovuma LNG project once force majeure is lifted, signaling renewed progress.
title: ExxonMobil says Mozambique LNG project to advance ‘quickly’ after force majeure lifted

excerpt: Lukoil has declared force majeure on oil shipments from Iraq’s West Qurna 2 field following new U.S. sanctions, marking the first major disruption to the Russian producer’s international operations.
title: Lukoil declares force majeure on Iraq oil shipments following U.S. sanctions

excerpt: Ranger Energy Services is set to become the largest well-servicing provider in the Lower 48 with its $90.5 million acquisition of American Well Services, expanding its Permian Basin rig fleet by 25% and boosting earnings and cash flow potential.
title: Ranger Energy to acquire American Well Services, expanding Permian footprint

excerpt: Shell has canceled plans for two offshore wind projects in Scotland, returning its CampionWind lease amid higher costs and a shift in clean energy strategy.
title: Shell withdraws from Scottish offshore wind projects amid rising development costs

excerpt: Mach Natural Resources reported third-quarter production of 94,000 boed and $273 million in revenue, supported by new wells in the Deep Anadarko and Mancos shale plays. The company also reduced its 2026 drilling and completion budget by 18%.
title: Mach Natural Resources grows production, boosts efficiency with Permian and San Juan assets

excerpt: Civitas Resources reported net income of $177 million and strong Q3 performance driven by higher output and lower costs across its Permian and DJ basin assets. The results come as Civitas finalizes its merger with SM Energy, creating one of the largest independent U.S. oil and gas producers.
title: Civitas Resources boosts production, lowers costs ahead of SM Energy merger

excerpt: The U.S. Bureau of Ocean Energy Management (BOEM) has announced two major steps toward expanding offshore oil and gas leasing under the Trump administration’s energy agenda and the One Big Beautiful Bill Act.
title: U.S. advances first offshore lease sales under Trump's OBBBA

excerpt: Three of the UK’s leading business organizations have called on the government to abolish the Energy Profits Levy, warning that the windfall tax is deterring investment, accelerating North Sea job losses, and threatening the region’s role in the nation’s energy transition.
title: UK business groups call for end to Energy Profits Levy as North Sea job losses mount

excerpt: INEOS Energy has signed a long-term U.S. natural gas supply deal with Kinetik Holdings, securing up to 0.5 MMtpa from 2027 to strengthen Europe’s energy security and stabilize prices amid tightening global supply.
title: INEOS signs U.S. natural gas supply deal with Kinetik to boost Europe’s energy security

excerpt: The American Petroleum Institute has released Bulletin 5100, confirming that Ordinary Portland Cement is a safe and reliable barrier material for CCUS wells. The new guidance compiles the latest research supporting its long-term performance in CO₂ injection and storage applications.
title: API publishes new bulletin confirming suitability of Portland cement for CCUS well applications

excerpt: Petrobras will begin production from the P-78 FPSO at Brazil’s Buzios field in December, expanding output from the world’s largest deepwater oil field. The new platform adds 180,000 bopd of capacity, supporting Petrobras’s continued growth in pre-salt production.
title: Petrobras to bring new FPSO online at Buzios field, boosting Brazil’s deepwater output

excerpt: Aker Solutions has secured a five-year brownfield services contract from ExxonMobil Canada for the Hebron platform offshore Newfoundland and Labrador. The significant NOK 1.5–2.5 billion award extends Aker Solutions’ long-running EPC and maintenance work on the platform, reinforcing its strong presence in Atlantic Canada’s offshore sector.
title: Aker Solutions wins five-year Hebron brownfield services contract from ExxonMobil Canada

excerpt: Petrobras has increased production from Brazil’s massive Buzios deepwater field to 1 million bpd, reinforcing its position as a top non-OPEC oil supplier.
title: Petrobras boosts Buzios deepwater oil output to 1 MMbpd, adding to global glut

excerpt: U.S. shale producers are increasing output despite $60 oil, leveraging drilling efficiencies and lower break-even costs to sustain record production.
title: U.S. shale operators defy $60 oil to sustain production growth

excerpt: Baker Hughes has received an order from Bechtel to supply liquefaction equipment for NextDecade’s Rio Grande LNG Train 5, adding 6 MMtpa of new capacity.
title: Baker Hughes wins order for NextDecade’s Rio Grande LNG Train 5 expansion

excerpt: DNO reported record Q3 revenue and profit, boosted by higher North Sea and Kurdistan output, and launched a fast-track plan for its Kjøttkake tie-back project.
title: DNO boosts Q3 profit, accelerates Norwegian tie-back project

excerpt: TotalEnergies has awarded Vallourec a new contract to supply 30,000 tons of tubular solutions for Iraq’s Gas Growth Integrated Project (AGUP2 phase).
title: TotalEnergies advances Iraq Gas Growth project with Vallourec premium tubular solutions

excerpt: Tenaris will build a 2.3-mile rail spur at its Midland, TX service center to boost Permian logistics efficiency, reduce costs, and cut emissions.
title: Tenaris expands Permian operations with new rail spur at Midland service center

excerpt: ConocoPhillips has increased the projected cost of its Willow development on Alaska’s North Slope to as much as $9 billion, citing inflation and higher construction expenses. First oil is expected in early 2029, marking a key update to one of the largest U.S. Arctic energy projects.
title: ConocoPhillips lifts Willow project cost to $9 billion, first oil set for early 2029

excerpt: Carbon Clean and SAMSUNG E&A have formed a global alliance to deliver modular carbon capture systems that cut costs and speed deployment. The partnership combines Carbon Clean’s CycloneCC™ technology with SAMSUNG’s EPC expertise to advance large-scale industrial decarbonization.
title: Carbon Clean, SAMSUNG E&A form alliance to accelerate deployment of modular carbon capture systems

excerpt: Aberdeenshire-based completions specialist Vulcan Completion Products (VCP) is marking a new stage in its global growth as its workforce approaches 40 employees and operations extend to nearly 50 countries.
title: Vulcan Completion Products expands global footprint with growing international team

excerpt: Energy NL CEO Charlene Johnson said Canada’s 2025 federal budget shows promising support for resource and infrastructure projects, but urged clarity on the emissions cap timeline. She highlighted tax incentives for carbon capture and LNG as positive for Newfoundland and Labrador’s energy industry.
title: Energy NL sees promise in Canada’s 2025 budget, presses for emissions clarity

excerpt: DNO ASA has strengthened its position in Norway’s Verdande oil field through a multi-asset swap with Aker BP, increasing its stake from 10.5% to 14%. The deal, part of DNO’s North Sea portfolio optimization strategy, includes divesting interests in the Vilje field, Kveikje discovery, and several exploration permits.
title: DNO streamlines Norwegian portfolio through multi-asset swap with Aker BP

excerpt: Halliburton has won an integrated drilling and completion services contract from Shell Nigeria and Sunlink Energies for the HI gas field in OML 144, which will supply feed gas to the Nigeria LNG Train 7 project.
title: Halliburton wins Shell Nigeria contract for HI gas field development

excerpt: Ovintiv will acquire NuVista Energy in a $2.7 billion cash-and-stock deal, adding 140,000 net acres and 100,000 boed of production in the Montney while planning to divest its Anadarko assets to strengthen its balance sheet.
title: Ovintiv to acquire NuVista Energy in $2.7 billion deal, advancing Montney growth strategy

excerpt: The UAE, long one of OPEC’s key oil producers, is pivoting to U.S.-tested fracing techniques to tap its “very promising” unconventional gas resources, with the intention of ramping up output amid forecasts for surging demand.
title: ADNOC taps U.S. shale expertise to unlock UAE’s unconventional gas potential

excerpt: IOG Resources II has acquired producing non-operated natural gas assets in Pennsylvania’s Appalachian basin from an undisclosed seller. Operated by Seneca Resources, the assets currently produce about 19 MMcf/d.
title: IOG Resources II acquires non-operated gas assets in Pennsylvania’s Appalachian basin

excerpt: Africa’s oil and gas industry is entering a new phase of consolidation and exploration as mergers, acquisitions, and fresh licensing rounds reshape the continent’s upstream landscape heading into 2026.
title: Africa’s upstream M&A poised for surge in 2026 as licensing rounds open new opportunities

excerpt: bp delivered $7.8 billion in operating cash flow and $2.2 billion in underlying profit for Q3 2025, supported by higher production, improved refining margins and strong upstream reliability. The company advanced six major projects—including new capacity in the U.S. Gulf—and sanctioned its Tiber-Guadalupe development.
title: bp reports $7.8 billion cash flow, strong upstream performance and six project startups in Q3 2025

excerpt: DeepOcean and Jana Marine have signed a Heads of Terms agreement to form JADE Subsea Services, a Saudi-based joint venture offering integrated subsea construction, IMR, and diving support across the Middle East.
title: DeepOcean launches Saudi subsea venture with Jana Marine

excerpt: EnerMech has announced a multi-year strategic investment across its Americas operations—spanning the U.S., Guyana, Trinidad & Tobago, Suriname, and Mexico—to strengthen local capability, expand leadership, and capture growth in LNG and offshore pre-commissioning markets.
title: EnerMech expands presence in Guyana, LNG markets under new leadership

excerpt: Comstock Resources reported higher third-quarter earnings on stronger gas prices and record Haynesville well performance. The company plans to sell its Shelby Trough assets for $430 million, using proceeds to reduce debt and reinforce its Haynesville growth focus.
title: Comstock boosts Haynesville output, to sell East Texas assets for $430 million

excerpt: Halliburton has launched its LOGIX™ unit vitality system, an AI-powered platform that monitors cementing equipment in real time to improve reliability, predict maintenance needs, and reduce nonproductive time.
title: Halliburton unveils AI-driven LOGIX™ system to enhance cementing equipment performance

excerpt: Chevron has entered two deepwater offshore blocks in Guinea-Bissau’s MSGBC basin, expanding its strategic footprint in West Africa. The U.S. major will operate Blocks 5B and 6B with 90% interest, focusing on oil exploration through new seismic interpretation.
title: Chevron eyes new oil plays in West Africa with Guinea-Bissau entry

excerpt: Petrobras’ plan to divest shallow-water oil fields has been derailed after Brazil’s regulator, ANP, denied testing needed to restart production at 13 sites. The decision forces the state oil firm to absorb costly decommissioning as global oil prices weaken.
title: Petrobras’ Brazil field sale stalls as regulators block shallow-water testing

excerpt: Coterra Energy defended its diversified U.S. oil and gas strategy after activist investor Kimmeridge called for leadership changes and divestitures. The company reaffirmed the value of its multi-basin model and disciplined capital approach.
title: Coterra rebuffs activist call for leadership overhaul, defends long-term strategy

excerpt: SM Energy and Civitas Resources have agreed to merge in an all-stock transaction valued at $12.8 billion, forming one of the largest independent oil-focused producers in the U.S. The combination delivers 526 MMboed of output, $1.4 billion in free cash flow, and $200 million in annual synergies.
title: SM Energy, Civitas Resources merge in $12.8 billion all-stock deal, creating a top-tier U.S. shale producer

excerpt: ExxonMobil CEO Darren Woods said Abu Dhabi’s Upper Zakum offshore field may reach its 1.5 MMbpd expansion target ahead of 2030, boosting UAE output.
title: ExxonMobil eyes early output boost at Abu Dhabi’s Upper Zakum field

excerpt: Beacon Offshore Energy has partnered with Tampnet to deploy advanced subsea fiber and 5G digital infrastructure at the Shenandoah deepwater development in the U.S. Gulf of Mexico. The system enables real-time monitoring, remote operations, and improved offshore safety.
title: Tampnet powers Beacon Offshore’s Shenandoah deepwater project

excerpt: Liberty Petroleum plans to begin drilling in 2026 across its 20-million-acre position in Australia’s Officer basin—one of the country’s largest untapped oil prospects. The U.S.-based firm’s project underscores deepening U.S.–Australia energy cooperation.
title: Liberty Petroleum moves toward 2026 drilling in Australia’s Officer basin

excerpt: ABL has been awarded a contract by Chevron to provide marine warranty survey and third-party support for platform installations and rig moves in the Gulf of Thailand.
title: Chevron taps ABL for platform installation, rig move services in Gulf of Thailand

excerpt: Shell will invest about $1 billion on new oil blocks in Angola as the southern African nation seeks to boost production that’s dwindled over the years, the chairman of the oil regulator said.
title: Shell expands in Angola with $1 billion offshore exploration investment

excerpt: Hit your most critical business outcomes and metrics using advanced edge computing
title: The power of fully connected oil & gas operations

excerpt: Chevron’s third-quarter earnings topped analyst forecasts as the company’s $53 billion Hess acquisition boosted global oil production and cash flow. Output rose 21% to 4.1 MMboed, supported by Hess’ stake in Guyana’s Stabroek Block.
title: Chevron beats estimates as Hess acquisition drives oil production growth

excerpt: ExxonMobil reported Q3 2025 earnings of $7.5 billion and record upstream production of 4.8 million boed, led by new output from Guyana’s Yellowtail project and record volumes in the Permian basin. The company also took FID on Hammerhead and expanded its Permian acreage with a Sinochem acquisition.
title: ExxonMobil ramps up global output with early Yellowtail startup and Permian gains

excerpt: Buccaneer Energy has selected a drilling rig for the Allar #1 development well in the Pine Mills Field, Texas, with drilling set to begin in late October. The company plans to produce oil at up to 124 bopd and use associated gas from the Fouke area to power a future Bitcoin mining operation.
title: Buccaneer Energy selects drilling rig for Allar #1 development well in Texas Pine Mills Field

excerpt: The Railroad Commission of Texas assessed more than $1 million in fines against oil and gas operators and pipeline businesses during its October 30, 2025, meeting, reinforcing its oversight of industry safety, environmental compliance, and regulatory enforcement across the state.
title: Texas Railroad Commission issues over $1 million in enforcement penalties for oil and gas operators

excerpt: Delta Sands LLC announced plans to construct a new 3-million-ton-per-year wet sand processing facility in East Texas to meet rising demand for high-quality in-basin proppant across the Western Haynesville Shale.
title: Major frac sand project to boost proppant supply across Western Haynesville

excerpt: Dana Gas and Crescent Petroleum have completed the $1.1 billion KM250 expansion at Iraq’s Khor Mor field eight months early, adding 250 MMscf/d of new processing capacity and strengthening power generation across the Kurdistan region.
title: Khor Mor gas capacity rises 50% as $1.1 billion Kurdistan expansion project completed early

excerpt: Flotek Industries’ XSPCT™ spectrometer has become the first optical system to meet GPA 2172 custody transfer standards for natural gas measurement. The real-time technology delivers faster, more accurate data than traditional gas chromatography.
title: Flotek’s XSPCT™ sets benchmark for accurate natural gas measurement

excerpt: An independent petroleum reserves and resources evaluation has confirmed world-class hydrocarbon potential in Greenland’s Jameson Land basin, identifying more than 13 billion barrels of prospective recoverable oil resources across 58 prospects.
title: Greenland’s Jameson Land basin holds 13 Bbbl oil potential, new report finds

excerpt: Shell plc delivered adjusted earnings of $5.4 billion and cash flow from operations of $12.2 billion in Q3 2025, supported by record output from deepwater assets in Brazil and the Gulf of America and robust LNG trading results.
title: Shell earnings rise on record deepwater output, LNG strength

excerpt: DeepOcean has been selected to deliver a major subsea decommissioning project offshore Western Australia, including the suspension of subsea trees, removal of flowlines, umbilicals, and a disconnectable turret-mooring buoy. The 2026 campaign will be managed from Perth, leveraging Shelf Subsea’s regional expertise.
title: DeepOcean awarded subsea decommissioning contract offshore Western Australia

excerpt: SLB OneSubsea has been awarded two EPC contracts by PTTEP to deliver subsea production systems for Malaysia’s deepwater Alum, Bemban, Permai, and Kikeh fields, extending the life of key offshore assets and strengthening regional energy security.
title: SLB OneSubsea lands dual EPC awards for deepwater Malaysia

excerpt: bp is advancing appraisal planning for its significant Bumerangue hydrocarbon discovery in the pre-salt Santos basin offshore Brazil, confirming a 1,000-meter gross hydrocarbon column with high-quality oil and liquids-rich gas condensate. The company expects appraisal activities to begin in early 2027.
title: bp advances plans for major Bumerangue discovery in Brazil’s Santos basin

excerpt: North Sea crude exports are set to reach their highest level since 2017, with December loadings forecast at 2.1 million bpd. Rising output from Johan Castberg and other key fields adds to a global oil supply glut expected to pressure prices into 2026.
title: North Sea oil loadings to hit eight-year high as global supply glut builds

excerpt: Sunda Energy is advancing preparations for the Chuditch-2 appraisal well offshore Timor-Leste, targeting drilling in early 2026, while expanding its Southeast Asian upstream portfolio with two new offshore licenses in the Philippines.
title: Sunda advances drilling preparations in Timor-Leste, expands Philippines portfolio
