excerpt: GD Energy Products has unveiled its new High Flow (HF) Series frac pumps — the GD 5000HF and GD 3600HF — designed to deliver up to 37% more flow per stroke, improved energy transfer, and reduced maintenance.
title: GD Energy Products launches next-generation High Flow Series frac pumps

excerpt: Subsea Supplies has expanded its Aberdeen base and signed an exclusive UK/European distribution and service agreement with Innerspace for its full line of electric and hydraulic thrusters, strengthening subsea support and regional supply capabilities.
title: Subsea Supplies expands Aberdeen base, signs European thruster deal with Innerspace

excerpt: U.S. President Donald Trump’s newly announced sanctions on Russian oil companies are facing a first major challenge in talks with Xi Jinping. Analysts say China’s response will be key to starving Kremlin revenue and tightening global oil markets.
title: Trump’s Russia oil sanctions face early test as meeting with China looms

excerpt: Resilience as a valuable trait in today’s industry was a major topic of discussion for day two of the 2025 Women’s Global Leadership Conference in Energy, in Houston. Across several morning panels, guest speakers from various industry-leading companies shared the strategies and necessity of resilience in a market and industry environment that is rapidly changing.
title: WGLC Day 2: Resilience in a shifting industry

excerpt: The Trump administration is ruling out plans to auction offshore oil and gas leases along the U.S. East Coast, scaling back its proposed five-year leasing program after opposition from coastal states and environmental groups.
title: Trump administration retreats from plan to open Atlantic offshore oil drilling

excerpt: The Norwegian Offshore Directorate has granted Equinor a drilling permit for well 7018/5-2 in production license 1236, located in the Barents Sea. The exploration well will be operated by Equinor with partners Vår Energi and Petoro.
title: Equinor approved to drill Barents Sea exploration well

excerpt: ExxonMobil, Chevron, Shell, bp and TotalEnergies are pushing ahead with production growth in 2025–2026 despite falling crude prices and rising OPEC supply. Analysts say the oil majors are taking the long view, investing now to secure future resilience.
title: Oil majors join OPEC in raising output as crude prices slide

excerpt: OMS Energy Technologies Inc. has expanded its partnership with a leading Thai oil and gas operator through a new Technical Service Partner Contract covering consultancy, gauging management, and hardware services.
title: OMS strengthens presence in Thailand with major oilfield service partnership

excerpt: Senegal is ramping up industrialization amid rising oil and gas production from the offshore Sangomar field and GTA LNG project, backed by energy, mining and transport investments to reposition the country as a West African industrial hub.
title: Senegal accelerates industrialization amid oil, gas production surge

excerpt: ADNOC Drilling reported record financial performance for the third quarter and first nine months of 2025, underscoring its role as ADNOC’s upstream growth engine and a key contributor to Abu Dhabi’s long-term energy strategy.
title: Record year for ADNOC Drilling as profits soar and new growth targets set

excerpt: Maersk Supply Service and Maritime Developments Ltd. (MDL) have completed a complex deepwater riser installation at Brazil’s Mero field using MDL’s largest offshore spread, advancing Petrobras’ pre-salt development.
title: Maersk, MDL complete complex deepwater riser installation at Brazil’s Mero field

excerpt: Sercel has been awarded a landmark contract by India’s Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) to supply land seismic acquisition systems. The systems will support ONGC’s 2026 exploration surveys across India’s diverse terrain.
title: Sercel wins major ONGC contract for seismic acquisition systems in India

excerpt: Canadian oil sands emissions increased by less than 1% in 2024 even as production rose 150,000 bpd, S&P Global Commodity Insights reports. Efficiency gains cut greenhouse gas intensity by 3% to 57 kgCO₂e per barrel.
title: Canadian oil sands achieve record output with minimal emissions increase, S&P Global reports

excerpt: The Railroad Commission of Texas is expanding outreach with new bi-monthly virtual listening sessions, giving Texans a chance to engage directly with state energy regulators and RRC experts.
title: Texas Railroad Commission enhances public engagement with new remote listening sessions

excerpt: In a message that resonated across the energy industry, Denise Hamilton, CEO and Founder of WatchHerWork, called on attendees to “reclaim real human connection” during her keynote address at the 2025 Women’s Global Leadership Conference in Energy (WGLC), hosted by Gulf Energy Information.
title: Energy leaders urged to “reclaim real human connection” at Day 1 of WGLC

excerpt: Odfjell Technology has been awarded a five-year contract to deliver fishing services for drilling and workover operations with a major oil and gas company in Kuwait, marking a continued expansion of its well services portfolio in the Middle East.
title: Odfjell Technology secures five-year contract in Kuwait’s oil sector

excerpt: Halliburton signed a framework agreement with Shell to deploy its ROCS umbilical-less tubing hanger system, following successful Gulf of America trials that set a new deepwater record and reduced deck operations by 75%.
title: Halliburton expands deepwater capabilities with new Shell framework agreement

excerpt: UK-based energy services provider Petrofac has applied to enter administration after a failed restructuring deal and the cancellation of a major North Sea contract, placing more than 7,000 jobs worldwide at risk.
title: Petrofac files for administration, putting 7,300 global energy jobs at risk

excerpt: WellSense has completed a successful U.S. field trial of its jet-propelled FiberLine Intervention Conveyance System (FliCS) in the Permian basin. The breakthrough fiber optic technology enables rapid, low-risk well diagnostics in horizontal wells.
title: Pioneering well conveyance technology completes successful Permian field trial

excerpt: SLB and Ormat Technologies have signed a strategic agreement to accelerate integrated geothermal asset development and deploy enhanced geothermal systems (EGS) at scale. The partnership includes an EGS pilot project and plans for global commercialization.
title: SLB and Ormat partner to accelerate geothermal development

excerpt: Weatherford and Maersk Training have partnered to launch the industry’s first all-level IADC-accredited Managed Pressure Drilling (MPD) training programs, combining advanced simulation and real-world expertise to enhance global drilling competency.
title: Weatherford, Maersk launch industry’s first IADC-accredited MPD training programs

excerpt: A new Siemens global study reveals energy resilience and independence have overtaken decarbonization as top priorities for executives worldwide, signaling a shift from global climate cooperation to national energy security ahead of COP30.
title: Energy security tops climate action as key driver of global transition, Siemens reports

excerpt: The National Ocean Industries Association (NOIA) has released Gulf of America Forward, a new report and website showcasing the Gulf as a leading global offshore energy hub driving U.S. jobs, innovation, and low-carbon production.
title: Gulf of America Forward: NOIA maps path for U.S. offshore energy growth

excerpt: TotalEnergies and its partners will restart the $20 billion Mozambique LNG project after lifting force majeure imposed in 2021 following militant attacks. The move marks a major step toward reviving one of Africa’s largest LNG developments.
title: TotalEnergies to restart Mozambique LNG project after force majeure lifted

excerpt: Tenaris has been awarded contracts to supply casing, tubing, line pipe, and coatings for Woodside’s Trion development—the first ultra-deepwater oil project in Mexico. The Trion field, developed with Pemex, targets first oil in 2028.
title: Tenaris wins supply contract for Mexico’s first ultra-deepwater Trion project

excerpt: Op-Ed: As Namibia’s Orange basin edges toward a 2026 final investment decision, Tom Alweendo outlines critical priorities in ports, local content, and permitting that will determine whether the country converts discovery momentum into credible investment.
title: Orange basin at a crossroads: Namibia faces key decisions ahead of 2026 FID

excerpt: Baker Hughes has won a multi-year contract from Aramco to expand coiled tubing drilling operations across Saudi Arabia’s gas fields, increasing its fleet from four to ten units. The project will enhance gas recovery and support the Kingdom’s drive to accelerate natural gas production.
title: Aramco awards Baker Hughes multi-year coiled tubing drilling contract

excerpt: Nomura Holdings says India’s shift away from discounted Russian crude will be offset by potential lower U.S. tariffs under a new trade deal, easing the impact on growth. Economists expect reduced levies to boost India’s export competitiveness while managing inflation risks from higher oil prices.
title: Lower U.S. tariffs to offset India’s shift from Russian oil, Nomura says

excerpt: Delfin Midstream has awarded Samsung Heavy Industries the exclusive EPCI contract for its first floating LNG vessel under the Delfin LNG project offshore Louisiana. The LOA paves the way for a 2025 final investment decision and a second vessel FID in early 2026.
title: Samsung Heavy Industries wins major FLNG construction contract for offshore U.S.

excerpt: Glenfarne Alaska LNG has signed a one MMtpa offtake agreement with Tokyo Gas, marking the fifth commercial deal in seven months and securing more than half of Alaska LNG’s planned export capacity.
title: Tokyo Gas signs offtake agreement with Glenfarne, boosting Alaska LNG momentum

excerpt: Tampnet will provide advanced digital connectivity infrastructure—including subsea fiber and private 5G—for LLOG Exploration’s Salamanca deepwater development in the U.S. Gulf of America/Gulf of Mexico.
title: Tampnet to deliver digital connectivity for LLOG’s Salamanca deepwater project in U.S. Gulf

excerpt: The Tony Blair Institute is urging the UK government to delay its 2030 clean power target and adopt a more gradual approach to decarbonization. The think tank’s report calls for prioritizing affordable energy, warning that rapid reforms risk eroding public support for climate policy.
title: Report: UK’s 2030 clean energy deadline unrealistic, Tony Blair Institute warns

excerpt: Baker Hughes has been named the winner of the fourth annual NOIA ESG Excellence Award, recognizing its leadership in offshore sustainability, data-driven emissions reduction, and responsible energy operations across more than 3,000 wells worldwide.
title: Baker Hughes wins NOIA ESG Excellence Award for advancing offshore sustainability

excerpt: The American Petroleum Institute (API) has released the third edition of API Standard 2RD, enhancing offshore safety and riser integrity for floating production systems. The updated standard unifies design methods, strengthens robustness requirements, and supports extended riser service life.
title: API strengthens offshore safety standards with new updates

excerpt: Japan’s JERA is expanding its U.S. upstream presence with a $1.5 billion acquisition in Louisiana’s Haynesville shale. The South Mansfield asset, producing 500 MMcf/d, positions JERA to double output to 1 Bcf/d and strengthen its global LNG value chain.
title: JERA expands U.S. upstream footprint with $1.5 billion Haynesville shale acquisition

excerpt: U.S. sanctions targeting Russian oil producers Rosneft and Lukoil are unsettling China’s oil industry, which relies on Moscow for up to 20% of its crude imports. The measures, part of the Trump administration’s wider energy sanctions, raise fears of supply disruptions and secondary penalties.
title: U.S. sanctions on Russian oil giants spark supply concerns in China

excerpt: Velesto Energy and ICON Engineering have signed an agreement to deliver rig-installed wellhead platforms for offshore Malaysia. The collaboration merges drilling and platform installation in one campaign — cutting costs, accelerating timelines, and expanding Malaysia’s offshore development capabilities.
title: Velesto and ICON launch collaboration to streamline offshore wellhead platform installations

excerpt: The Trump administration has reopened Alaska’s Arctic National Wildlife Refuge for oil and gas leasing, reversing a Biden-era ban and paving the way for a winter lease sale. Interior Secretary Doug Burgum said the move will expand U.S. fossil fuel production across 1.56 million acres of the Arctic coastal plain.
title: Trump greenlights Arctic drilling, reversing Biden’s Alaska oil ban

excerpt: Dutch emission-reduction technology innovator Value Maritime has appointed MIE Group Ltd as its new commercial agent in Cyprus, reinforcing its commitment to expanding across the Mediterranean region.
title: Value Maritime expands Mediterranean presence with appointment of commercial agent in Cyprus

excerpt: U.S. oil and gas mergers and acquisitions dropped to $9.7 billion in Q3 2025, marking the third straight quarterly decline, according to Enverus Intelligence Research. Analysts cite persistently low crude prices and fewer private-equity exits.
tags: North America,Industry Trends,Oil and Gas Prices,Economics/Statistics
title: U.S. upstream M&A slows sharply in Q3 amid weak crude market

excerpt: Aker BP reported strong results with 414,000 boed production, robust cash flow, and a major Omega Alfa discovery in Norway’s Yggdrasil area. The find ranks among the largest on the Norwegian Continental Shelf in a decade and supports long-term offshore growth.
title: Aker BP strengthens offshore portfolio with Omega Alfa discovery, major project progress

excerpt: The U.S. Department of Energy has issued the final non-FTA export authorization for Venture Global’s CP2 LNG terminal in Cameron Parish, Louisiana. The approval enables exports to non-FTA countries and supports the U.S.’s advancing role in global LNG markets.
title: Venture Global wins key regulatory clearance for U.S. LNG development

excerpt: The American Petroleum Institute (API) is urging Congress to reconsider the Nationwide Consumer and Fuel Retailer Choice Act of 2025, arguing that the proposed E15 biofuel legislation no longer reflects current market realities. API warns that new state mandates and federal rule changes threaten fuel stability and investment certainty.
title: API urges Congress to rethink E15 legislation amid shifting market realities

excerpt: bp and Japan’s JERA are winding down their U.S. offshore wind joint venture, JERA Nex bp, citing an unfavorable policy environment under the Trump administration. The decision halts the planned 2.5-GW Beacon Wind project off Massachusetts amid a broader industry pullback.
title: bp to exit U.S. offshore wind market as Trump administration tightens oversight

excerpt: Brazil’s latest oil auction signaled a revival in offshore exploration, with Petrobras, Equinor, and Chinese firms among the winners. The pre-salt round saw five of seven blocks awarded, underscoring renewed deepwater interest despite soft crude prices and cautious global spending.
title: Brazil oil auction draws renewed offshore exploration interest

excerpt: Shell has appealed a South African court ruling that overturned the environmental permit for offshore Block 5/6/7, a key exploration license once held by TotalEnergies. The case highlights growing tension between energy investment and environmental opposition.
title: Shell appeals South African court ruling halting offshore exploration

excerpt: Vår Energi reported strong third-quarter 2025 results, achieving early start-up at seven offshore projects including Johan Castberg and Balder’s Jotun FPSO. The company expects Q4 output of 430,000 boed and plans to sanction ten new Norwegian Continental Shelf developments in 2025.
title: Vår Energi delivers record offshore output as new Norwegian fields drive long-term growth

excerpt: Halliburton and VoltaGrid have entered into a strategic collaboration to develop and deploy distributed power generation systems designed to meet the surging energy needs of the global data center industry, with the first projects planned for the Middle East.
title: Halliburton, VoltaGrid collaborate on power systems for global data center expansion

excerpt: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) says Saudi Arabia’s fiscal balance and current account depend heavily on oil price recovery and higher crude output. A 1 MMbpd rise in production could lift the kingdom’s fiscal balance by 3.2% of GDP as Vision 2030 spending expands.
title: Saudi fiscal outlook hinges on oil price recovery, production growth, IMF says

excerpt: Galp Energia is expanding upstream exploration in frontier markets such as Namibia and São Tomé and Príncipe amid resilient global oil demand. “The world has changed,” said a board member on Tuesday. “The energy transition is happening, but Europe still needs fossil fuels.”
title: Galp targets frontier exploration in Africa as oil demand persists

excerpt: A consortium led by DeepOcean — including TotalEnergies, Equinor, Aker BP, Tenaris, and LS Cable & System — has developed FlowHeat, a subsea pipeline heating system that reduces installation costs by 35% and emissions by 30%, extending tieback reach to 30–50 km in deepwater projects.
title: DeepOcean advances subsea flowline heating innovation with TotalEnergies, Equinor, and Aker BP

excerpt: The Trump administration will purchase 1 MMbbl of crude oil to begin replenishing the U.S. Strategic Petroleum Reserve (SPR), marking the first step toward restoring the nation’s emergency supply following years of drawdowns.
tags: North America,U.S. Onshore,Oil and Gas Prices
title: Trump will buy 1 MMbbl to help replenish Strategic Petroleum Reserve

excerpt: Brazil’s state-run Petrobras has received environmental approval to begin drilling its first exploration well in the Foz do Amazonas basin after years of regulatory delay. The project could open a new offshore frontier comparable to Guyana’s oil-rich plays, as Brazil seeks to sustain output beyond 2030.
title: Petrobras wins approval to drill first exploration well near Amazon River

excerpt: Aquaterra Energy has appointed Matt Marcantonio as its new Head of Engineering, marking a significant step in the company’s continued growth and commitment to advancing offshore technologies.
title: Aquaterra Energy strengthens leadership with Head of Engineering appointment

excerpt: Halliburton reported $5.6 billion in Q3 2025 revenue, led by North America growth and steady international results. Adjusted earnings rose to $496 million as the company emphasized cost discipline, technology leadership and shareholder returns.
title: Halliburton CEO Jeff Miller highlights cost savings, tech focus in third-quarter update

excerpt: Forum Energy Technologies’ (FET) Subsea division has secured a contract to supply two of its new-generation XLX EVO III work-class remotely operated vehicles (ROVs) to Nigerian offshore operator Marine Platforms Ltd. (MPL).
title: FET to deliver two new work-class ROVs to Nigerian oil and gas firm

excerpt: Kent has been awarded the FEED contract by Al-Khafji Joint Operations (KJO) for the Khafji Desalter and Water Treatment Plant upgrade. The project will sustain 300,000 bpd of crude production and expand treatment capacity to over 500,000 bpd.
title: Kent secures FEED contract from KJO for Khafji desalter and water treatment plant upgrade

excerpt: MariEnergies has announced an oil discovery at its Shawal-1 exploration well, located in the Mari Development and Production Lease (Mari D&PL). MariEnergies operates Pakistan’s largest gas reservoir in the Mari D&PL area and is the nation’s second-largest gas producer.
title: MariEnergies discovers oil at Shawal-1 exploration well in Pakistan

excerpt: Rockwell Automation has released a new report highlighting artificial intelligence (AI), the Internet of Things (IoT), and cybersecurity as leading drivers of digital transformation across the global oil and gas sector.
title: AI, automation and IoT lead next phase of digitalization across oil and gas sector

excerpt: GeoPark has finalized its acquisition of the Loma Jarillosa Este and Puesto Silva Oeste blocks from Pluspetrol in Argentina’s Vaca Muerta formation, marking its formal entry as operator in one of South America’s most productive unconventional oil regions.
title: GeoPark takes operatorship of two key Vaca Muerta blocks following Pluspetrol deal

excerpt: Oil prices are on track for a third consecutive weekly loss as global oversupply forecasts and renewed U.S.-China trade tensions weigh on market sentiment. Brent crude traded near $60 a barrel, with analysts citing slowing demand growth and rising inventories as key factors.
title: Brent crude slides toward $60 on oversupply, U.S.-China trade strains

excerpt: The UK’s remaining proven and probable oil and gas reserves were estimated at 2.9 billion barrels of oil equivalent (boe) at the end of 2024, according to the latest Reserves and Resources Report published by the North Sea Transition Authority (NSTA).
title: North Sea recoverable oil and gas resources rise 31% after last licensing round, new report shows

excerpt: Inpex CEO Takayuki Ueda says Indonesia is pressing to accelerate the $20 billion Abadi LNG development as domestic and regional gas demand surges. The project, targeting 9.5 MMtpa of LNG capacity, remains on track for a 2027 FID despite cost and design challenges.
title: Indonesia urges Inpex to expedite $20 billion LNG project amid rising demand

excerpt: RINA has secured the front-end engineering and design (FEED) contract for PETRONAS CCS Ventures’ Southern Onshore Facilities, part of Malaysia’s landmark carbon capture and storage (CCS) development.
title: RINA awarded FEED contract for PETRONAS’ flagship CCS project in Malaysia

excerpt: Halliburton and Aker BP have completed the first umbilical-less tubing hanger installation on the Norwegian Continental Shelf using Halliburton’s eROCS digital control system and Optime Tubing Hanger Orientation System.
title: Halliburton, Aker BP achieve industry-first installation on Norwegian Continental Shelf

excerpt: The 2025 Gulf Energy Information Excellence Awards in Houston honored this year's upstream innovators, including SLB, Saudi Aramco, Halliburton, ExxonMobil, Baker Hughes, Oil States, NOV and Reliance Industries. Winners were recognized for advancements in deepwater and drilling technologies, digital transformation, completions and more.
title: Upstream winners honored at 2025 Gulf Energy Information Excellence Awards in Houston

excerpt: Equinor and partners ExxonMobil, Petrogal Brasil, and PPSA have started production from the Bacalhau field in Brazil’s Santos basin. With recoverable reserves exceeding 1 billion boe and a 220,000 bpd FPSO, Bacalhau is Equinor’s largest international project.
title: Equinor starts production at Bacalhau, its largest international field

excerpt: India’s foreign ministry said it was unaware of any conversation between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and President Donald Trump after the U.S. leader claimed Modi had agreed to stop Russian oil purchases. Despite U.S. pressure and new tariffs, India maintains it will continue buying Russian crude.
title: India denies Trump’s claim of agreement to halt Russian oil imports

excerpt: Perenco CEO Armel Simondin says the independent producer plans to expand into new countries to secure resources and sustain 500,000 bpd of production. The company will maintain $2 billion in annual investment, focus on mature oil fields in Africa, and grow natural gas output through projects like Gabon’s barge-mounted LNG plant.
title: Perenco targets expansion into new countries to sustain oil and gas production growth

excerpt: Suriname is rapidly rising as the Caribbean’s next major oil and gas hub, driven by deepwater discoveries in the Guyana–Suriname basin. The nation anticipates first production in 2028 and new investments by TotalEnergies, APA, and Petronas.
title: Suriname’s deepwater success signals new phase of oil and gas development

excerpt: Halliburton has secured multiple contracts from Petrobras to deliver completion, stimulation, and safety valve services across Brazil’s deepwater fields. The projects, starting in 2026, will deploy Halliburton’s SmartWell® and EcoStar® technologies.
title: Halliburton wins Petrobras contracts to enhance deepwater Brazil field performance

excerpt: Valeura Energy and partner Pinnacle Turkey have signed a joint venture agreement with Transatlantic Petroleum to explore and develop deep gas formations in Türkiye’s Thrace basin. The partnership will begin with the re-entry and testing of the Devepinar-1 well, targeting commercial potential in the Kesan formation.
title: Valeura enters Türkiye JV with Transatlantic Petroleum to advance deep gas exploration

excerpt: DeepOcean has entered a time charter agreement for the multipurpose vessel Glomar Supporter to strengthen its survey, inspection, and light IMR service offering across offshore wind and oil and gas markets.
title: DeepOcean enters charter agreement to expand IMR, survey capabilities in EU

excerpt: TotalEnergies expects third-quarter profit and cash flow to rise up to 5% year-on-year, supported by higher oil and gas production and stronger European refining margins. Hydrocarbon output grew 4% to 2.5 MMboed, offsetting lower crude prices.
title: TotalEnergies sees slight profit increase on higher oil output

excerpt: Global energy and marine consultancy ABL has secured a new contract from India’s Oil and Natural Gas Corporation Limited (ONGC) to oversee rig moving operations across Indian waters between September 2025 and May 2026.
title: ABL wins ONGC rig moving contract covering 95 offshore operations in India

excerpt: bp and the Shah Deniz consortium have awarded three major offshore contracts worth about $700 million to the Saipem and BOS Shelf joint venture for the Shah Deniz Compression (SDC) project in the Caspian Sea.
title: bp awards $700 million in contracts for Shah Deniz offshore gas project

excerpt: The International Energy Agency forecasts global oil supply will exceed demand by nearly 4 million barrels per day in 2026—its largest annual surplus on record. The build-up, driven by revived OPEC+ output and rising non-OPEC production from the U.S., Brazil, and Guyana, is already visible in tanker storage volumes.
title: IEA projects record oil oversupply in 2026 as OPEC+ output rebounds

excerpt: The Oil and Gas Climate Initiative’s (OGCI) 2024 Progress Report shows continued emissions reductions across its 12 member companies, including Aramco, bp, Chevron, ExxonMobil, and TotalEnergies. Since 2017, members have reduced upstream methane intensity by 62%.
title: OGCI reports continued progress cutting emissions and expanding CCUS

excerpt: bp said weaker oil trading offset profit gains in the third quarter, though production rose for a second consecutive quarter led by U.S. shale output from BPX Energy. The company is advancing six new upstream projects expected to add 150,000 boed at peak.
title: bp sees weaker oil trading but stronger upstream production growth

excerpt: Santos Chief Financial Officer Sherry Duhe has resigned after one year, following the collapse of a proposed $19 billion merger with ADNOC. Duhe will be replaced by deputy CFO Lachlan Harris as the company refocuses on LNG growth projects.
title: Santos CFO resigns after one year amid corporate transition, M&A fallout

excerpt: Speaking at the historic Drake Energy Security Forum, American Petroleum Institute (API) President and CEO Mike Sommers urged policymakers to strengthen U.S. energy leadership through innovation and infrastructure investment.
title: API’s Mike Sommers calls for new era of U.S. energy leadership, infrastructure investment

excerpt: Shell and joint venture partner Sunlink Energies have approved development of the HI gas project offshore Nigeria. The H1 field represents a $2 billion investment, according to Nigerian government, and bolsters Shell’s strategy to grow global LNG output through 2030.
title: Shell greenlights $2 billion gas project offshore Nigeria

excerpt: Sonatrach and Saudi Arabia’s Midad Energy have signed a $5.4 billion production-sharing agreement to explore and develop the Illizi South block in Algeria. The project aims to produce 125 Bcm of gas and 204 million barrels of liquids over 30 years.
title: Sonatrach, Midad sign $5.4 billion hydrocarbon deal in Algeria’s Illizi basin

excerpt: NGP Natural Resources has partnered with 406 Energy Holdings, a new Houston-based upstream venture led by former XCL Resources executives. The company plans to target high-return oil and gas development opportunities across the U.S.
title: NGP backs new 406 Energy venture targeting U.S. upstream growth

excerpt: Serica Energy has agreed to buy bp's 32% stake in the Culzean field, the UK’s largest offshore gas producer. The $232 million deal expands Serica’s North Sea portfolio and adds low-cost, low-emission production operated by TotalEnergies.
title: Serica Energy to acquire bp's stake in UK’s largest offshore gas field

excerpt: Carnelian Energy Capital has closed a $600 million oversubscribed fund aimed at upstream oil and gas investments in Canada, signaling renewed private equity confidence in the region’s energy sector.
title: Carnelian closes $600 million fund for Canadian upstream ventures

excerpt: The five-well campaign begins in 2026 and includes options for three more wells, extending the company’s global deepwater activity.
title: bp awards Valaris $140 million drilling contract offshore Egypt

excerpt: Valeura Energy has increased oil production to nearly 25,000 bpd after completing a 10-well drilling campaign at its Nong Yao field in the Gulf of Thailand. The company also advanced its Wassana redevelopment project and confirmed new gas discoveries under its PTTEP farm-in.
title: Valeura boosts offshore Thailand output with 10-well Nong Yao drilling campaign

excerpt: Kuwait Oil Co. has announced a major offshore gas discovery at the Jazah field, with initial tests showing 29 MMcf/d of gas and 5,000 bpd of condensate. The find could hold 1 Tcf of gas and 120 million barrels of condensate, marking a key milestone for Kuwait’s offshore exploration.
title: Kuwait strikes major offshore gas discovery in Persian Gulf

excerpt: ExxonMobil CEO Darren Woods said the company is cutting back European investments due to restrictive climate regulations, while praising President Donald Trump’s energy policies for supporting oil and gas growth.
title: ExxonMobil retreats from Europe, credits Trump for pro-oil stance

excerpt: Adnoc Gas CEO Fatema Al Nuaimi says the upcoming wave of global LNG supply through the decade will spark sustained demand growth, as lower prices encourage long-term adoption in emerging markets.
title: Global LNG supply surge will drive lasting demand growth, says ADNOC Gas CEO

excerpt: Equinor is preparing to begin production at its $8 billion Bacalhau project offshore Brazil, following delays at one of the largest deepwater developments in the company’s portfolio. The ultra-deep pre-salt field is expected to produce up to 220,000 bpd.
title: Equinor prepares to start delayed deepwater project offshore Brazil

excerpt: Score has secured significant new contracts from INEOS Energy for the Greensand carbon storage project and additional LDAR framework agreements across Denmark, reinforcing its leadership in carbon capture and emissions reduction.
title: INEOS awards major carbon capture and LDAR contracts to Score

excerpt: U.S. geothermal lease bids have surged to record highs, driven by data-center energy demand and advances in drilling and completions technology. Oilfield methods such as fracing and high-temperature well design are powering geothermal’s next growth phase.
title: Record geothermal lease prices signal new frontier for subsurface drilling

excerpt: Strathcona Resources Ltd. has formally withdrawn its takeover bid for MEG Energy Corp., citing new terms in MEG’s revised agreement with Cenovus Energy Inc. that render the proposed acquisition no longer feasible.
title: Strathcona terminates MEG takeover bid following Cenovus agreement

excerpt: Beacon Offshore Energy has achieved its target production rate of 100,000 bopd at the Shenandoah field in the U.S. Gulf, just 75 days after first oil, confirming the high operability of the Shenandoah floating production system.
title: Shenandoah field reaches 100,000 bpd milestone in deepwater U.S. Gulf

excerpt: bp has started up production from the Murlach field in the UK North Sea—its sixth major upstream project of 2025. The two-well subsea tieback adds about 15,000 boed in peak output to the ETAP hub, advancing bp’s plan to deliver 10 new oil and gas projects by 2027.
title: bp starts production from Murlach field, marking sixth project start-up in 2025

excerpt: A new S&P Global Commodity Insights analysis finds absolute greenhouse gas emissions from the Permian basin have fallen nearly 20% since 2022, even as oil and gas production increased by about 500,000 barrels per day.
title: Permian emissions fall 20% since 2022 even as output rises, new study finds

excerpt: Sintana Energy Inc. has agreed to acquire Challenger Energy Group PLC in an all-share transaction valued at approximately C$83.6 million. The deal expands Sintana’s high-impact offshore exploration footprint in Uruguay and Namibia.
title: Sintana to acquire Challenger, expanding Atlantic exploration portfolio

excerpt: Baytex Energy Corp. is considering divesting its Eagle Ford shale operations in south Texas, potentially fetching up to $3 billion, as the Calgary-based producer shifts strategic focus back to its Canadian oil portfolio.
title: Baytex mulls $3 billion Eagle Ford sale to refocus on Canadian operations

excerpt: Houston-based Sable Offshore Corp. is seeking assistance from the Trump administration to revive crude production offshore Santa Barbara, Calif. The company’s plans to restart pipelines from the Santa Ynez Unit have been delayed by state regulators, prompting consideration of shipping oil by tanker instead.
title: Sable Offshore seeks Trump's support to advance stalled California offshore oil project

excerpt: Chevron is preparing to drill the Korikori-1 exploration well this month, according to Suriname's state-owned oil company Staatsolie. Drilling is expected to last around 90 days and will target potential hydrocarbon accumulations in the shallow offshore zone of the Suriname-Guyana basin.
title: Chevron set to drill Korikori-1 exploration well in Suriname’s Block 5

excerpt: Shell is preparing to restart development work on Venezuela’s offshore Dragon gas field, a key step toward resuming natural gas exports to Trinidad and Tobago, pending U.S. authorization expected in the coming weeks.
title: Shell to resume offshore Venezuela gas development as U.S. eases path for exports

excerpt: ExxonMobil has signed new agreements with Iraq’s Basra Oil Co. and SOMO to explore and develop the Majnoon oil field, marking its first upstream re-entry into Iraq since exiting West Qurna-1 in early 2024.
title: ExxonMobil signs Majnoon oil field deal, marking return to Iraq

excerpt: Cenovus Energy has raised its takeover offer for MEG Energy to C$7.6 billion, sweetening terms ahead of a delayed shareholder vote. The deal would expand Cenovus’s footprint across Alberta’s Christina Lake oil sands, where MEG produces about 100,000 bpd.
title: Cenovus raises MEG offer as competition intensifies in Canada’s oil sands sector

excerpt: McDermott and Namibia’s PETROFUND have signed an MOU to expand technical training and workforce development in the nation’s growing upstream oil and gas sector.
title: McDermott, PETROFUND sign agreement to develop Namibia’s oil and gas workforce

excerpt: ABB will deliver automation and electrification systems for SwitcH2’s floating green ammonia FPSO off Portugal, designed to produce 243,000 tons annually from renewable power.
title: ABB to supply automation, electrification systems for green ammonia FPSO offshore Portugal

excerpt: Chevron has relaunched its Clarity® line of premium ashless hydraulic oils. The updated formulations deliver high performance, extended equipment protection, and improved environmental compatibility across industrial and heavy-duty applications.
title: Chevron reintroduces Clarity line of ashless hydraulic oils for sustainable performance

excerpt: Civitas Resources and SM Energy are discussing a merger of equals that reflects the next wave of consolidation among U.S. shale producers. The potential combination would strengthen both companies’ Permian basin operations and enhance efficiency.
title: Civitas explores strategic merger with Permian rival SM Energy

excerpt: Allseas has awarded Able Group contracts to dismantle, reuse, and recycle two of TAQA UK’s most significant North Sea platforms — Cormorant Alpha and Tern — marking one of the largest decommissioning projects ever undertaken in the region.
title: Allseas awards North Sea decommissioning contracts to Able for TAQA UK platforms

excerpt: ReconAfrica is drilling ahead into the Otavi carbonate reservoir at its Kavango West 1X exploration well in Namibia. The company expects to reach total depth in November, followed by a full evaluation of the reservoir section.
title: ReconAfrica advances drilling at Kavango West 1X exploration well in Namibia

excerpt: Chevron Corp. has appointed TotalEnergies exec Kevin McLachlan as its new VP of Exploration, effective November 1, succeeding Liz Schwarze, who will retire in February 2026 after 36 years with the company.
title: Chevron names Kevin McLachlan to lead global exploration as Liz Schwarze announces retirement

excerpt: The Texas Railroad Commission has established the State Task Force on Petroleum Theft (STOPTHEFT) to address rising oilfield crime. The 13-member group includes leaders from ConocoPhillips, Diamondback Energy, and the Texas Oil & Gas Association, alongside state and federal law enforcement.
title: Texas launches new task force to fight organized oilfield theft

excerpt: Oil prices steadied after OPEC+ announced a modest 137,000-bpd increase for November, signaling continued supply restraint from Saudi Arabia and its allies.
title: OPEC+ supply decisions keep oil prices steady amid cautious market outlook

excerpt: U.S. crude oil output hit a record 13.6 million bpd in July, prompting the U.S. Energy Information Administration to revise its 2025-26 outlook. The EIA now forecasts production will average 13.5 million bpd in both 2025 and 2026, modestly higher than its September forecast.
title: EIA raises U.S. oil production forecast after record July output

excerpt: Executives from TotalEnergies, Chevron and bp highlighted at African Energy Week 2025 how improved subsurface imaging and streamlined approvals could spark a new exploration renaissance across key basins such as Namibia, the Congo, and Egypt’s Nile Delta.
title: TotalEnergies, Chevron push for faster permits, advanced seismic data in Africa

excerpt: TotalEnergies has appointed Nicola Mavilla as Senior Vice President of Exploration effective Nov. 1, 2025, succeeding Kevin McLachlan after a decade in the role.
title: TotalEnergies appoints Eni veteran as new exploration leader

excerpt: Shell-led LNG Canada is preparing to load its first cargo from Train 2 this month, marking the next phase of Canada’s expanding LNG export capacity.
title: Shell’s LNG Canada project nears first Train 2 cargo amid production ramp-up

excerpt: Baker Hughes is moving ahead with its planned acquisition of Chart Industries after shareholders of Chart approved the deal. Expected to close by mid-2026, the transaction will expand Baker Hughes’ energy and industrial technology portfolio, particularly in LNG, data centers, and clean energy markets.
title: Baker Hughes advances $13.6 billion Chart acquisition following shareholder approval

excerpt: Forum Energy Technologies has secured a contract from DOF to deliver a work-class XLX-C24 ROV and tether management system for subsea operations offshore Brazil.
title: Forum Energy Technologies secures ROV contract with DOF for Brazil subsea operations

excerpt: Zephyr Energy plc announced the results of an updated Competent Person’s Report (CPR) for its Paradox basin assets in Utah, revealing a major upgrade in reserves and resource estimates for the company’s flagship Paradox project.
title: Zephyr Energy announces huge reserves boost, production potential in Paradox basin

excerpt: QatarEnergy has signed an agreement with Shell to acquire a 27% participating interest in the North Cleopatra offshore block in Egypt’s Herodotus Basin. Pending government approval, Shell will remain operator with 36%, alongside Chevron (27%) and Tharwa Petroleum (10%).
title: QatarEnergy buys Shell stake in offshore Egypt exploration block

excerpt: Transocean Ltd. has announced new contract fixtures totaling $243 million in firm backlog for two ultra-deepwater drillships. bp exercised a 365-day option for the Deepwater Atlas in the U.S. Gulf, while Petrobras exercised a 30-day option for the Deepwater Mykonos offshore Brazil.
title: Transocean secures $243 million in contract extensions for ultra-deepwater drillships

excerpt: Angola’s National Oil, Gas & Biofuels Agency (ANPG) aims to award 60 oil and gas concessions by the end of 2025, building on 50 already allocated since 2019 through licensing rounds and direct negotiations.
title: Angola targets 60 oil and gas concessions by end-2025 through licensing drive

excerpt: Unit Corporation has sold its Unit Drilling Company subsidiary to Cactus Drilling in a $120 million all-cash transaction, marking a strategic exit from the contract drilling business. The divestiture allows Unit to sharpen its focus on upstream oil and gas operations and pursue new drilling opportunities.
title: Unit Corporation sells contract drilling subsidiary to Cactus Drilling in $120 million deal

excerpt: OPEC+ members are debating the size of their next oil supply increase, with options ranging from a modest 137,000 bpd to a larger boost. The decision, expected at the November meeting, comes as crude prices trade near four-month lows.
title: OPEC+ seeks consensus on November oil supply increase amid price pressures

excerpt: The American Petroleum Institute (API) welcomed a federal court ruling that overturned a previous administration’s attempt to permanently ban new offshore oil and gas leasing, calling the decision a major step toward restoring access to U.S. energy resources.
title: API applauds court ruling overturning federal offshore leasing ban

excerpt: U.S. political momentum and African regulatory reforms are converging to create what leaders at African Energy Week 2025 described as a strategic opening for U.S. investment in Africa’s upstream oil and gas sector.
title: U.S. political momentum and African reforms fuel upstream investment drive

excerpt: OPEC+ has agreed to raise oil production by 137,000 barrels per day in November, signaling a cautious approach as Saudi Arabia and Russia reached consensus after differing on supply strategy.
title: OPEC+ agrees to modest oil production increase for November

excerpt: EnerMech has secured a subsea pre-commissioning contract for a major offshore gas project in Australia’s East Browse basin, covering riser and umbilical services from October 2025 to April 2026.
title: EnerMech wins major subsea contract for Australian offshore gas development

excerpt: SLB and SBM Offshore have entered an exclusive digital alliance to develop an AI-driven ecosystem aimed at optimizing FPSO production. The partnership combines SLB’s digital platforms and domain expertise with SBM Offshore’s lifecycle knowledge.
title: SLB and SBM Offshore form alliance to enhance FPSO operations with AI

excerpt: Berkshire Hathaway has agreed to buy Occidental Petroleum’s OxyChem unit for $9.7 billion in cash, marking Berkshire’s largest deal since 2022. Occidental plans to use $6.5 billion of proceeds to cut debt below $15 billion, reinforcing its strategy to prioritize long-term oil and gas development in the Permian basin.
title: Warren Buffet's Berkshire Hathaway to acquire Occidental's OxyChem for $9.7 billion

excerpt: The Railroad Commission of Texas (RRC) has assessed more than $1.5 million in penalties against oil and gas operators and businesses during its latest open meeting, underscoring the agency’s continued focus on regulatory enforcement and compliance across the industry.
title: Texas regulator imposes $1.5 million in penalties against oil and gas operators

excerpt: Danos has acquired Panel Specialists Inc., in a deal that broadens its’ technical services footprint in Houma, Louisiana, enhancing automation, control, and reliability solutions for upstream oil and gas customers.
title: Danos acquires Panel Specialists to expand automation, valve services

excerpt: TotalEnergies has signed a farm-down agreement with CarbonVault for Denmark’s Bifrost Carbon Capture and Storage project in the North Sea, holding a 45% operator stake alongside CarbonVault (35%) and Nordsøfonden (20%).
title: TotalEnergies partners with CarbonVault on CCS project in Danish North Sea

excerpt: Eni has approved the $7.2 billion Coral Norte floating LNG project offshore Mozambique, which will add 3.6 million tons per year of LNG capacity and double the country’s production. Set to start in 2028, Coral Norte positions Mozambique as Africa’s third-largest LNG producer after Nigeria and Angola.
title: Eni approves $7.2 billion Coral Norte LNG project offshore Mozambique

excerpt: North Sea Midstream Partners (NSMP) has received first gas from Shell’s Victory field, the first new West of Shetland gas since 2017. Gas is flowing through the SIRGE and FUKA pipelines to the St Fergus Terminal, bolstering UK energy security and reducing reliance on imported LNG.
title: Shell brings first gas from Victory Field in UK North Sea, partnering with NSMP on delivery

excerpt: AXP Energy has confirmed oil and gas across multiple pay zones in its Charlie #1 well in Noble County, Oklahoma. Wireline logs identified hydrocarbons in the Oswego Lime, Mississippi Chat, Mississippi Lime and Woodford Shale intervals.
title: AXP Energy finds oil and gas across multiple zones in Oklahoma well

excerpt: Rhino Resources Namibia Ltd. has confirmed a significant gas condensate discovery at the Volans-1X exploration well in Block 2914A, offshore Namibia’s Orange basin. The find represents the company’s third consecutive hydrocarbon discovery on Petroleum Exploration License 85 (PEL 85).
title: Rhino confirms high-liquid gas condensate discovery at Volans-1X offshore Namibia

excerpt: Weatherford International launched its Industrial Intelligence digital portfolio at the FWRD 2025 Technology Conference in Houston, introducing advanced edge automation, digital twin technology, and AI-powered platforms.
title: Weatherford launches industrial intelligence platform at FWRD 2025 in Houston

excerpt: Elea Data Centers has secured a R$2.3 billion (US$500 million) contract from Petrobras to build a large-scale, renewable-powered data center in São Paulo. The 17-year agreement is being described as the largest IT infrastructure award of its kind in Latin America.
title: Petrobras taps Elea to build $500 million renewable-powered data center in Brazil

excerpt: Enverus Intelligence Research warns that Illinois’ ban on CO₂ sequestration beneath the Mahomet Aquifer has halted 5.6 MMtpa of carbon storage projects and could set a precedent nationwide, putting 20% of U.S. carbon capture capacity at risk.
title: Illinois regulation could threaten key CCUS projects, analysts warn

excerpt: Tamboran Resources will acquire Falcon Oil & Gas in a $172 million deal, consolidating ~2.9 million net acres in Australia’s Beetaloo basin. The transaction strengthens Tamboran’s position as a leading shale gas operator in one of Australia’s most prospective plays.
title: Tamboran to acquire Falcon Oil & Gas, creating 2.9-million-acre Beetaloo basin leader

excerpt: At the Energy Workforce & Technology Council’s (EWTC) 2025 Business Optimization Conference, leaders spotlighted two urgent priorities for the oilfield services sector—meeting surging global power demand with U.S. LNG and navigating policy and workforce hurdles to sustain growth.
title: Permitting reform is key to U.S. energy expansion, urges Energy Workforce

excerpt: Why pump uptime isn’t the real measure of frac efficiency. True performance requires autonomous pressure control—especially in simul-frac operations—to optimize transitions, reduce downtime and deliver smarter, more meaningful gains.
title: Frac chaos out, autonomous control in

excerpt: DeepOcean has secured a SIMOPRO offshore installation contract from Equinor on Norway’s Åsgard and Visund fields. The scope includes riser replacement, umbilical installations, and subsea infrastructure work, with operations planned for summer 2026 using the Edda Freya vessel.
title: DeepOcean secures Equinor SIMOPRO contract for Åsgard and Visund fields

excerpt: ExxonMobil plans to eliminate about 2,000 jobs worldwide, representing 3–4% of its workforce, as part of a global restructuring plan that will see Exxon consolidate offices into regional hubs focused on core growth areas.
title: Exxon to cut 2,000 jobs as oil sector workforce reductions accelerate

excerpt: Equatorial Guinea and Chevron have signed an agreement for the development of the Aseng Gas Project in Block I. The Aseng project represents an initial investment of $690 million, and underscores the country's long-term strategy to become a premier hub for natural gas in Africa.
title: Equatorial Guinea boosts LNG production with Chevron Aseng agreement

excerpt: Equatorial Guinea has signed a Heads of Agreement (HOA) with ConocoPhillips to develop offshore Blocks B/4 and EG-27, a deal expected to unlock up to $9 billion in investment and support the country’s ambition to expand its role as a regional gas processing hub.
title: ConocoPhillips signs deal to advance offshore gas development in Equatorial Guinea

excerpt: TotalEnergies has sold a $1.25 billion U.S. solar portfolio stake to KKR while acquiring a 49% interest in Continental Resources’ Oklahoma gas assets. The strategy highlights the French major’s balance between recycling capital from renewables and reinforcing its upstream oil and gas position in North America.
title: TotalEnergies divests solar assets, expands upstream portfolio with U.S. gas deal

excerpt: Occidental Petroleum is in talks to sell its OxyChem petrochemical unit in a deal worth at least $10 billion, the Financial Times reported Sunday. The divestment would be the U.S. company’s biggest yet.
title: Occidental Petroleum in talks to sell OxyChem unit for at least $10 billion

excerpt: Operator LLOG Exploration has achieved first production at the Salamanca Floating Production Unit in the deepwater U.S. Gulf. The facility, located in 6,400 ft of water, marks the first reuse of a former Gulf production unit repurposed for new development.
title: First oil flows at Salamanca FPU in deepwater U.S. Gulf

excerpt: TAY Oil Services and Polaris have commissioned a major onshore seismic survey for AGOCO in Libya’s Concession 57, deploying 40,000 STRYDE seismic nodes across 1,480 km². The project marks North Africa’s largest nodal seismic acquisition to date.
title: TAY Oil-Polaris taps STRYDE for pioneering onshore seismic survey in Libya

excerpt: BKV Corporation has closed its $370 million acquisition of Bedrock Energy Partners’ Barnett shale assets, adding 97,000 net acres, 108 MMcf/d of production, and expanded drilling inventory to solidify its role as the basin’s largest gas producer.
title: BKV completes $370 million acquisition of Barnett shale assets

excerpt: bp has reached a final investment decision on the $5 billion Tiber-Guadalupe development, advancing its second new production hub in the U.S. Gulf of America/Gulf of Mexico in less than two years.
title: bp greenlights $5 billion Tiber-Guadalupe deepwater project in U.S. Gulf

excerpt: Carlos Slim’s Grupo Carso has secured a $1.99 billion contract with Pemex to drill 32 wells at the Ixachi gas and condensate field in Veracruz. The project affirms Pemex's efforts to boost output amid mounting debt and a push for energy self-sufficiency by 2027.
title: Carlos Slim’s Grupo Carso signs $2 billion drilling deal with Pemex for Ixachi field

excerpt: Nigeria has approved TotalEnergies’ $510 million sale of its 12.5% stake in OML 118, home to the Bonga deepwater field, to Shell and Nigerian Agip Exploration as part of Total’s global divestment strategy.
title: Nigeria approves TotalEnergies’ $510 million Bonga divestment to Shell, Agip

excerpt: TotalEnergies has entered a new phase of its strategic partnership with Cognite, aimed at scaling industrial artificial intelligence (AI) across all of the company’s operated upstream assets worldwide.
title: TotalEnergies expands Cognite partnership to scale industrial AI across global operations

excerpt: Seatrium has signed an MoU with Cochin Shipyard to strengthen offshore collaboration in India and Asia, targeting MRO projects, technology partnerships and growth in regional energy markets.
title: Seatrium, Cochin Shipyard sign MoU to expand offshore collaboration in India, Asia

excerpt: BW Energy is evaluating a potential acquisition of Azule Energy’s non-operated interests in Angola’s Block 14/14K, part of its strategy to expand offshore oil and gas assets, the company stated, while clarifying that no binding agreement has been reached.
title: BW Energy eyes offshore Angola expansion with potential block 14/14K acquisition

excerpt: In a new Op-Ed, Texas Railroad Commissioner Wayne Christian backs President Trump’s blunt UN remarks, calling the global climate agenda a costly con that threatens U.S. energy security.
title: Opinion: President Trump is right on UN climate agenda—Enough is enough

excerpt: Motive Offshore Group has acquired Norway-based Weld Integrity Group, strengthening its Certification & Inspection division and expanding non-destructive testing (NDT) and inspection services in the offshore Norway region.
title: Motive Offshore expands inspection capabilities with Weld Integrity acquisition in Norway

excerpt: At the Tomorrow Show in Oslo, Norway, Mun Hon Chow, Flow Assurance Lead at Shell, outlined how real-time dynamic digital twins are redefining field management and unlocking new opportunities for production optimization.
title: Shell showcases real-time digital twin breakthroughs at Tomorrow Show

excerpt: TechnipFMC has secured a substantial contract from ExxonMobil Guyana to deliver subsea production systems for the Hammerhead development in the Stabroek Block, marking its seventh greenfield award in the country since 2017.
title: Exxon Guyana awards subsea work to TechnipFMC for Hammerhead project

excerpt: Aker BP and FourPhase have executed the first-ever remote offshore solids management operation in the North Sea. The two-month project reduced offshore exposure, improved efficiency and safety, and set a new benchmark for future digital and remote well interventions.
title: Aker BP, FourPhase deliver industry-first remote solids management project in North Sea

excerpt: WellSense and FrontRow Energy Technology Group completed their first technology divestment as Halliburton acquires a global license for FiberLine Intervention (FLI) well diagnostics technology, advancing well stimulation monitoring and efficiency in the oilfield sector.
title: Halliburton secures global license for WellSense FiberLine Intervention technology

excerpt: bp no longer expects global oil demand to peak this year, projecting growth through the 2030s instead. In its latest Energy Outlook, the company forecasts demand reaching 103.4 million barrels a day by 2030.
title: bp forecasts higher oil consumption, drops view of near-term peak

excerpt: SLB has secured a major Petrobras contract for up to 35 ultra-deepwater wells in Brazil’s Santos Basin Atapu and Sépia fields, deploying advanced electric completions and digital technologies to enhance production and reservoir management.
title: SLB wins major Petrobras completions contract for Brazil ultra-deepwater wells

excerpt: GeoPark has acquired operated interests in the Loma Jarillosa Este and Puesto Silva Oeste blocks in Argentina’s Vaca Muerta shale from Pluspetrol, adding 12,300 acres, immediate production and growth to 20,000 boed by 2028.
title: GeoPark enters Vaca Muerta with acquisition of two blocks from Pluspetrol

excerpt: Nabors Industries and Caturus Energy have launched the PACE-X Ultra™ X33 rig, the most powerful onshore drilling system in the U.S. The rig enables complex well designs, including 4-mile laterals and 14,000+ ft depths, setting new benchmarks for efficiency, safety and lower-carbon operations.
title: Nabors, Caturus launch 4-mile shale rig for ultra-high pressure drilling

excerpt: ExxonMobil and Petrobras have raised competition concerns over the planned merger of Saipem and Subsea 7 into Saipem7. The companies warn the $21 billion deal could limit subsea pipeline installation options, drive up costs, and reduce supplier diversity in offshore projects.
title: ExxonMobil, Petrobras raise red flags on Saipem7 merger, citing deepwater competition risks

excerpt: Aggreko and Katoni Engineering have partnered to deliver a tailored temporary power solution for a North Sea offshore platform turnaround, cutting nearly £900,000 in fuel costs and preventing 4.5 tonnes of CO₂ emissions.
title: Aggreko and Katoni Engineering cut emissions, fuel costs on North Sea platform turnaround

excerpt: With Africa requiring up to $240 billion annually to meet its energy and climate goals, attracting investment is more crucial than ever. A consistent theme emerging across the continent is the need for stable and transparent regulatory frameworks to foster investor confidence and drive sustainable development.
title: Stable regulatory frameworks driving upstream investment in Africa

excerpt: KBC has released Maximus® 7.6, the latest version of its modeling and flow assurance platform for upstream oil and gas operations. The software is designed to close the gap between early-stage production planning and day-to-day asset management.
title: KBC launches latest modeling, flow assurance platform for upstream operations

excerpt: Enverus has launched its Global Research platform, expanding oil and gas intelligence worldwide. The first report spotlights Argentina’s Vaca Muerta shale, revealing discounted M&A opportunities compared to U.S. shale assets, alongside production trends and inventory insights.
title: Enverus expands global oil and gas intelligence with focus on Vaca Muerta shale deals

excerpt: Weatherford has secured an eight-year contract with Romgaz, Romania’s largest natural gas producer, to deploy real-time digital wellsite monitoring and AI-enabled production optimization. The deal marks Romgaz’s first use of such technology, enhancing efficiency across thousands of wells.
title: Weatherford wins long-term wellsite monitoring work for Romania's Romgaz

excerpt: Suriname’s government is negotiating with bondholders to delay debt repayments until offshore oil revenues begin in 2028. With TotalEnergies set to tap 760 million barrels of reserves, the economy aims to stabilize finances and attract investment while preparing for its first crude output.
title: Suriname seeks debt refinance ahead of 2028 oil production start

excerpt: Condor Energies has launched a multi-well drilling program in Uzbekistan as the Canadian independent looks to expand natural gas production and reserves across its portfolio in Central Asia.
title: Condor Energies begins multi-well gas drilling campaign in Uzbekistan

excerpt: Viking Completion Technology has achieved a key milestone in North Africa after delivering upper completion equipment for an onshore oil project, underscoring the company’s growing role in the region’s upstream sector.
title: Viking expands North Africa footprint with major upper completions delivery

excerpt: SLB will acquire RESMAN Energy Technology, adding world-leading tracer and reservoir surveillance solutions to its portfolio. The deal strengthens SLB’s production optimization and recovery capabilities for oil, gas, and emerging CCS projects.
title: SLB acquires RESMAN to enhance tracer technology, recovery solutions

excerpt: U.S. President Donald Trump criticized the UK’s North Sea oil tax regime and green energy push in a UN speech, warning that Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s policies risk shutting down new offshore development.
title: Trump slams UK for stifling North Sea exploration in UN address

excerpt: Wood Mackenzie has entered into a strategic data partnership with Novi Labs to enhance its Lens Lower 48 solution, integrating operator-verified well data and AI-driven lease-to-well algorithms. The partnership will cover 4.4 million wells that account for over 20% of global oil and gas supply.
title: Wood Mackenzie, Novi partner to enhance U.S. lower 48 well data accuracy

excerpt: TechnipFMC has secured a significant subsea production systems contract with Petrobras, valued between $75–$250 million. The award covers new offshore developments, brownfield expansions, and revitalizations in Brazil, with all systems manufactured locally.
title: TechnipFMC wins Petrobras contract for subsea production systems in Brazil

excerpt: Seatrium Limited has agreed to sell its AmFELS Yard in Brownsville, Texas, to Karpower Valley LLC for $65 million. The divestment enhances capital efficiency while maintaining Seatrium’s U.S. market presence through technology centers and service hubs.
title: Seatrium sells AmFELS yard in Texas to Karpowership affiliate in $65 million deal

excerpt: ExxonMobil has approved the $6.8 billion Hammerhead development offshore Guyana, marking its seventh project in the Stabroek block. The development will add 150,000 bopd starting in 2029, boosting total block capacity to 1.5 million bopd.
title: ExxonMobil greenlights seventh Guyana project, adding 150,000 bpd capacity

excerpt: Petrofac has extended its long-running partnership with Ithaca Energy, winning a two-year, $50 million contract renewal to provide integrated services across the operator’s UK North Sea portfolio.
title: Petrofac secures $50 million Ithaca Energy contract renewal in UK North Sea

excerpt: Forum Energy Technologies has introduced ICE Unity, its advanced ROV control system designed to streamline offshore operations. The system features a unified user interface, remote monitoring, predictive maintenance, and compatibility across FET’s full ROV fleet.
title: Forum Energy Technologies launches ICE Unity ROV control system for offshore operations

excerpt: Ocean Geophysics has teamed up with EdgeTech to deliver advanced software for the new eBOSS system, enhancing detection of buried subsea objects critical to offshore oil and gas operations.
title: Ocean Geophysics and EdgeTech partner to enhance offshore seabed data processing

excerpt: BW Offshore has achieved first gas on the BW Opal FPSO at Santos’ Barossa LNG project offshore Australia. The FPSO, designed to process 850 MMscf/d of gas and 11,000 bpd of condensate, marks a key milestone ahead of full operations under its 15-year charter.
title: BW Offshore FPSO achieves first gas in milestone for Santos LNG project

excerpt: Angola’s crude oil output rebounded to 1.03 million bpd in August, surpassing the 1 million mark after slipping in July. The government aims to sustain production levels as it prepares a new licensing round—the final under its multi-year concession strategy.
title: Angola’s oil production rebounds above 1 million bpd, licensing round planned

excerpt: Colombia’s Ecopetrol is seeking oil and gas deals in Brazil, with a focus on Petrobras’s Bahia Terra onshore cluster and other exploration opportunities in the Potiguar and Reconcavo basins.
title: Ecopetrol targets Brazil’s onshore oil and gas, eyes Petrobras Bahia Terra cluster

excerpt: Chevron, Anadarko, and Westlawn have partnered to explore offshore blocks in Peru’s Trujillo Basin, signing modified license agreements with Perupetro. The consortium plans to analyze 6,018 km² of seismic data, with exploratory drilling targeted after 2026 that could unlock up to 150,000 bpd of oil production.
title: Chevron, Anadarko join consortium to explore offshore Peru's Trujillo basin

excerpt: Nigeria’s NNPC Ltd. is accelerating upstream oil and gas growth with new production sharing contracts alongside TotalEnergies, crude supply agreements and gas pipeline progress. The company aims to attract $60 billion in upstream investment by 2030.
title: Nigeria's NNPC expands upstream portfolio with deepwater PSCs, $60 billion investment drive

excerpt: Tracerco has introduced its chemical tracer technology into a U.S. carbon capture and storage project for the first time. Adapted from enhanced oil recovery applications, the tracers provide ultra-sensitive leak detection, track plume migration, and verify CO₂ containment.
title: Tracerco deploys tracer technology in U.S. CCS milestone

excerpt: Texas upstream oil and gas employment ticked upward in August, with direct jobs reaching 205,100, according to new data from the Texas Independent Producers and Royalty Owners Association (TIPRO).
title: Texas upstream employment rises in August as industry job postings surge

excerpt: Trinidad and Tobago has officially closed its 2025 Deepwater Competitive Bidding Round, launched in January and featuring 26 offshore blocks. CNOOC International submitted bids for three blocks, while the STIT Energy–GROUNDPORTS consortium bid on one.
title: Trinidad and Tobago closes 2025 deepwater competitive bidding round

excerpt: In today’s global energy landscape, where operating risks are high and scrutiny can be intense, certification provides a competitive advantage, rooted in quality and consistency. The American Petroleum Institute (API) has long helped define what quality and consistency look like, developing widely adopted standards and certification programs that support safe, reliable and efficient operations across the oil and natural gas industry.
title: Mark of excellence: API certification demonstrates quality, reliability and trust

excerpt: IMI has successfully delivered what are believed to be the largest production choke valves ever manufactured to a landmark unmanned processing platform in the North Sea.
title: IMI delivers ‘largest production’ choke valves to landmark North Sea unmanned platform

excerpt: TAQA UK has awarded offshore contractor Allseas a major contract to decommission the Brae Alpha platform topsides in the Central North Sea, marking another milestone in one of the UK’s largest offshore decommissioning programs.
title: TAQA awards Brae Alpha decommissioning contract to Allseas

excerpt: FutureOn has launched major upgrades to its FieldTwin platform, introducing advanced visualization, reporting, and AI-powered FieldTwin Intelligence to accelerate offshore subsea project design and operations.
title: FutureOn adds AI-powered intelligence to FieldTwin, expanding offshore digital twin capabilities

excerpt: ExxonMobil CEO Darren Woods blasted the EU’s new Corporate Sustainability Due Diligence Directive, calling it “bone-crushing” for upstream operators. The law, set for full rollout by 2029, would mandate binding net-zero plans across global supply chains and fine violators up to 5% of global revenue.
title: Exxon CEO slams EU climate and human rights directive as threat to oil and gas competitiveness

excerpt: ARGAS has become the first company to deploy STRYDE’s nodal seismic technology in Egypt, acquiring 30,000 Range+ nodes and the Nimble system for a large 2D survey. The move marks a breakthrough in onshore seismic acquisition.
title: ARGAS deploys STRYDE node technology in Egypt’s first onshore seismic survey

excerpt: ExxonMobil says global energy demand will hold steady, reinforcing its long-term fossil fuel strategy. The company plans to double LNG sales by 2030, expand production in Guyana and the Permian, and advance new LNG projects in Mozambique and Papua New Guinea.
title: Exxon doubles down on oil, gas, and LNG through 2050

excerpt: The U.S. Senate has confirmed former Energy Workforce & Technology Council (EWTC) CEO Leslie Beyer as Assistant Secretary for Land and Minerals Management at the Department of the Interior, a role with sweeping oversight of U.S. oil, gas and mining activity on federal lands and offshore.
title: Former EWTC CEO Leslie Beyer confirmed as U.S. Interior Assistant Secretary

excerpt: Oregen Energy has expanded its position in Namibia’s emerging Orange basin, one of the world’s most closely watched oil frontiers, as international operators ramp up appraisal and development efforts following a string of large discoveries.
title: Canadian investment firm expands stake in Namibia's Orange basin as exploration momentum builds

excerpt: Weatherford International plc has been awarded a three-year, $147 million contract by Petrobras to deliver Tubular Running Services (TRS) across the company’s offshore drilling operations in Brazil.
title: Weatherford wins $147 million Petrobras contract for tubular running services

excerpt: Geoteric and PETRONAS Carigali have signed a landmark strategic agreement to deploy AI-driven seismic interpretation software across PETRONAS’ portfolio. The collaboration will accelerate hydrocarbon exploration, reduce cycle times by up to 90%, and enhance digital transformation in E&P operations.
title: Petronas signs strategic AI partnership with Geoteric to accelerate hydrocarbon exploration

excerpt: Emerson has launched AspenTech Subsurface Intelligence™ (ASI), a cloud-native, AI-powered platform designed to accelerate upstream decision making.
title: Emerson unveils AspenTech AI platform to accelerate upstream decisions

excerpt: A new IEA report warns that accelerating oil and gas field decline rates could remove the equivalent of Brazil and Norway’s combined production each year without continued upstream investment, raising concerns for energy security and market balance.
title: Global oil and gas fields shrinking output, IEA urges investment now

excerpt: TotalEnergies has signed production sharing contracts for four offshore blocks covering 12,700 sq km in the Liberia Basin. The company is planning a 3D seismic survey as it targets new deepwater prospects aligned with its global exploration strategy.
title: TotalEnergies secures four offshore exploration blocks in Liberia licensing round

excerpt: ADNOC's XRG has withdrawn its $19 billion bid for Santos, ending a high-profile push to expand in Australia’s LNG market amid valuation and tax disagreements.
title: ADNOC's XRG unit abandons $19 billion Santos LNG takeover bid

excerpt: Baker Hughes has secured a multi-year agreement with Petrobras to extend deployment of the Blue Marlin and Blue Orca stimulation vessels, supporting production optimization across Brazil’s offshore pre- and post-salt fields.
title: Baker Hughes wins Petrobras contract extension for offshore stimulation vessels

excerpt: Canada has approved the $10 billion Ksi Lisims LNG project, a floating export facility backed by Blackstone, Rockies LNG, and the Nisga’a Nation. Set to start by 2028, the project will become Canada’s second-largest LNG export terminal.
title: Canada approves Blackstone-backed LNG project, paving way for $7 billion export facility

excerpt: A new Rystad Energy study commissioned by AXPC highlights the vital role of independent producers in U.S. oil and gas. In 2024, onshore independents supported 3.1 million jobs and generated $488 billion in GDP output while producing over 85% of crude and 90% of natural gas.
title: Independent producers anchor U.S. oil, gas growth and economic impact, Rystad study finds

excerpt: South Africa’s Constitutional Court is set to rule on Shell’s disputed offshore seismic survey, a decision that could shape the future of the nation’s oil and gas exploration. The case, driven by environmental activists, has stalled Shell’s Wild Coast program since 2021.
title: Shell vs. activists: Dispute over offshore blocks reaches South Africa's highest court

excerpt: Energy NL has written to Newfoundland and Labrador’s provincial party leaders ahead of the 2025 election, seeking clear positions on offshore oil and gas, Bay du Nord incentives, federal emissions cap regulations, and renewable energy development.
title: Energy NL presses Newfoundland party leaders on offshore oil, Bay du Nord and renewables policy

excerpt: Aker BP is deepening its partnership with Cognite to deploy Cognite Atlas AI™, advancing its AI-first strategy in exploration and production. By harnessing agentic AI, Aker BP aims to boost efficiency, cut costs, and accelerate digital transformation across operations.
title: Aker BP expands AI-first strategy with Cognite to transform E&P efficiency

excerpt: Subsea7 has secured a $750 million –$1.25 billion offshore contract with Aramco in Saudi Arabia for the engineering, procurement, construction, and installation of 106 km of pipelines, topsides modifications and hook-up work. Offshore operations are planned for 2027–2028.
title: Aramco awards Subsea7 major offshore pipeline contract for Saudi Arabia

excerpt: Global OTEC has been selected by the DeepStar consortium, backed by Chevron, ExxonMobil and bp, to study Ocean Thermal Energy Conversion (OTEC) as a renewable power source for deepwater oil and gas operations.
title: Global OTEC joins DeepStar project to advance offshore renewable power for deepwater oil and gas

excerpt: MEG Energy has rejected Strathcona Resources’ sweetened C$7.6 billion bid, backing Cenovus Energy’s cash-heavy offer instead. The oil sands producer’s board cited risks tied to Strathcona’s shares and reaffirmed support for Cenovus ahead of an October shareholder vote.
title: MEG Energy rejects Strathcona’s latest bid in favor of Cenovus cash deal

excerpt: California Resources Corporation has agreed to acquire Berry Corporation in an all-stock merger valued at $717 million, including net debt, the companies announced today. The transaction will consolidate two of California’s largest upstream operators, creating a combined entity with more than 160,000 boed of production and 652 MMboe of proved reserves.
title: CRC to acquire Berry in $717 million all-stock merger, expanding California oil assets

excerpt: TotalEnergies, alongside Basra Oil Company and QatarEnergy, has launched construction of the final two major components of Iraq’s multibillion-dollar Gas Growth Integrated Project (GGIP), a landmark upstream and energy transition initiative.
title: TotalEnergies launches final phase for Iraq’s GGIP development

excerpt: GATE Energy has been awarded the full commissioning scope for bp’s Kaskida Floating Production Unit (FPU) in the U.S. Gulf. Working with Seatrium, GATE will provide systems completion, dynamic commissioning, and interface coordination for the deepwater project.
title: GATE Energy secures full commissioning contract for bp’s Kaskida deepwater FPU

excerpt: EnerMech has played a key role in developing the American Petroleum Institute’s (API) first certification program for Bolted Flange Joints (BFJs), a new industry credential designed to improve integrity, reliability, and safety across the oil and gas sector.
title: EnerMech experts help shape API’s first Bolted Flange Joint safety certification

excerpt: Chord Energy will acquire 48,000 acres and 9,000 boed of production in the Williston Basin from ExxonMobil’s XTO Energy for $550 million. The deal, effective Sept. 1, strengthens Chord’s drilling inventory and lowers its breakeven costs.
title: Exxon’s XTO sells $550 million Williston basin assets to Chord Energy

excerpt: TAQA (Industrialization & Energy Services Company) has introduced the Esaar™ mud motor, designed to improve drilling performance and serviceability. Built for durability in high-torque and corrosive conditions, the motor has been field-tested across a range of well types.
title: TAQA launches Esaar™ mud motor, setting new standards for drilling durability, flexibility

excerpt: Canada’s LNG expansion strategy gained momentum as Prime Minister Mark Carney placed Shell’s LNG Canada project on the national priority list, fast-tracking approvals for a potential doubling of export capacity.
title: Shell LNG Canada expansion fast-tracked under PM Carney’s national projects list

excerpt: ABS has granted approval in principle (AIP) to SBM Offshore for its pioneering Blue Ammonia floating production storage and offloading (FPSO) concept, advancing offshore gas conversion and decarbonized fuel production.
title: SBM's blue ammonia FPSO concept earns ABS approval

excerpt: Kuwait Petroleum Corp. is considering leasing $7 billion worth of pipelines to fund its $65 billion investment program, with $33 billion focused on boosting upstream oil production capacity to 4 million bpd by 2035.
title: Kuwait Petroleum eyes $7 billion pipeline deal to fund upstream oil expansion

excerpt: Petrobras has acquired a 27.5% interest in offshore Block 4 in São Tomé and Príncipe, reinforcing its upstream exploration strategy in Africa. The acquisition places Petrobras in a consortium led by Shell (30%), alongside Galp (27.5%) and ANP-STP (15%).
title: Petrobras boosts African exploration with new São Tomé offshore block stake

excerpt: The EPA under President Trump plans to end the Greenhouse Gas Reporting Program, halting emissions tracking from power plants, industrial facilities, oil refineries and other major polluters. The move could obscure 2.6 billion metric tons of emissions annually while saving businesses $2.4 billion in regulatory costs.
title: Trump's EPA moves to end emissions reporting program for U.S. oil, gas and industrial polluters

excerpt: Woodside has received final environmental approval from the Australian Government for the North West Shelf Project Extension, ensuring continued LNG supply, jobs, and investment while meeting cultural and environmental safeguards.
title: Woodside secures final approval for North West Shelf Project extension

excerpt: Baker Hughes has secured a major award from Turkish Petroleum (TPAO) and TP-OTC to deliver subsea production systems and intelligent completions for the Sakarya Gas Field Phase 3 in the Black Sea, enhancing Turkiye’s domestic energy production.
title: Baker Hughes wins subsea contract for Turkish gas field

excerpt: Equinor is considering combining parts of its renewable energy portfolio with Danish offshore wind developer Ørsted, in a move that could reshape the global offshore wind and clean energy market.
title: Equinor explores combining renewables assets with Orsted

excerpt: Chevron, in partnership with Helleniq Energy, has submitted a bid to explore four offshore gas blocks in Greece near Crete and the Peloponnese. The move aligns with Greece’s strategy to expand domestic gas resources and support Europe’s shift away from Russian energy.
title: Chevron submits bid for offshore gas exploration blocks in Greece
