excerpt: Pelican, Greenland Exploration, and March GL have merged to form Greenland Energy, advancing oil and gas drilling in Greenland’s Jameson Land Basin, a region long considered one of the most promising undrilled hydrocarbon basins in the Arctic.
title: $215 million merger forms Greenland Energy to unlock Arctic drilling potential

excerpt: Argentina’s Vaca Muerta shale remains resilient despite political and economic risks, according to President Javier Milei’s top oil and gas official.
title: Argentina’s Vaca Muerta shale can withstand political risk, Milei’s energy chief says

excerpt: The Permian Strategic Partnership (PSP) has appointed Jack Harper as its new chairman, strengthening leadership for one of the most influential coalitions in the U.S. oil and gas industry. Harper, a longtime Permian exec, will guide PSP’s growth mission for the region.
title: Permian Strategic Partnership names Jack Harper as new Chairman to drive West Texas growth

excerpt: Production from the Bakken had been expected to rise heading into late 2025 and early 2026, but weaker oil prices and rising competition from Canada have contributed to slower drilling in the region, analysts said.
title: Bakken oil production signals slowdown as key pipeline flows decline

excerpt: MOL and O&GD have discovered a new oil field at a depth of approximately 2,400 m near Galgahévíz, Hungary. The well, named Galgahévíz-4, is capable of producing approximately 1,000 bopd, which is processed at the Danube Refinery in Százhalombatta.
title: Partners MOL, O&GD strike oil in Hungarian field

excerpt: Forum Energy Technologies (FET) has been awarded a contract to upgrade two remotely operated vehicles (ROVs) for a global vessel operator. The upgraded systems will be equipped with FET’s latest control system, ICE Unity, plus FET’s proven system architecture.
title: FET wins ROV upgrade contract for global operator

excerpt: PACC Offshore Services (POSH) has appointed Longitude to deliver marine operations engineering for the Republic of Congo’s Nguya FLNG. The project, part of Eni’s Congo LNG Phase 2, will boost LNG export capacity to 2.4 MMtpa.
title: ABL unit lands engineering contract for Eni's Congo FLNG

excerpt: Alaska LNG, led by Glenfarne, has signed a Letter of Intent with JERA for 1 MMtpa of LNG over 20 years. The Alaska LNG project is the only federally approved LNG export project on the U.S. Pacific Coast.
title: Alaska LNG signs 20-year offtake agreement with Japan's JERA

excerpt: Rex International reported August 2025 production of 12,230 boed from assets in Norway, Oman and Germany, led by output from the Brage, Yme and Yumna fields.
title: Rex International's oil and gas output led by Norway fields

excerpt: Cenovus CEO Jon McKenzie says the company will not raise its takeover bid for MEG Energy, rejecting rival Strathcona’s higher all-stock offer as shareholder approval looms.
title: Cenovus rules out higher bid for MEG amid Strathcona takeover battle

excerpt: TotalEnergies has reached FID with partners on Rio Grande LNG Train 4 in Texas, gaining a 10% stake and 1.5 MMtpa offtake capacity from the new liquefaction unit.
title: TotalEnergies secures 10% direct stake in Rio Grande LNG Train 4 project

excerpt: U.S. oil producers have slashed $2 billion in spending and laid off thousands of workers amid falling prices and OPEC+ supply increases, threatening a slowdown in production growth.
title: Industry job losses and $2 billion cuts threaten U.S. oil output growth

excerpt: McDermott has won a contract with Monkey Island LNG to provide FEED services for its planned facility in Cameron Parish, Louisiana. McDermott's modular LNG train design enables delivery of up to 60% more LNG per acre than comparable projects.
title: McDermott wins key engineering work for $25 billion LNG project

excerpt: California Governor Gavin Newsom is seeking to impose further restrictions on the state's offshore oil industry, a setback to Sable Offshore Corp. and its controversial project off the coast of Santa Barbara County.
title: Sable faces setback as Newsom seeks more restrictions for offshore oil

excerpt: bp has signed an MoU with the Egyptian government for a five-well drilling program to boost natural gas production. The agreement comes as bp plans to increase production to 2.3-2.5 million boed in 2030 with the capacity to increase production out to 2035.
title: bp signs deal to drill five gas wells offshore Egypt

excerpt: The American Petroleum Institute (API) has published a new policy roadmap urging U.S. Congress to modernize the nation’s outdated permitting system and ensure access to affordable, reliable energy at a time of rising demand.
title: API urges Congress to fix broken permitting system

excerpt: Argent LNG will integrate AI and robotics into the development, construction, and operation of its flagship 25 MMtpa Port Fourchon LNG export terminal in Louisiana, as part of a broad digital strategy to improve operational efficiency and reduce capex.
title: Argent LNG to integrate AI, robotics into Port Fourchon development

excerpt: Leading oil and gas operators in Angola, including ExxonMobil, TotalEnergies, Chevron, Sonangol and Cabship, reaffirmed their commitment to advancing Angola’s next phase of oil exploration and production at the Angola Oil & Gas 2025 Conference and Exhibition.
title: Oil majors reaffirm plans for Angolan exploration, production

excerpt: Diversified Energy Company Plc will acquire Canvas Energy in a $550 million deal that significantly expands the company's producing assets and acreage positions in Oklahoma. Approximately 23 high-quality producing wells are included in the acquisition.
title: Diversified Energy acquires Canvas in $550 million deal to boost Oklahoma production

excerpt: Kongsberg Digital has entered a strategic partnership with Petroleum Development Oman (PDO) to deliver an enterprise AI-powered digital twin. Kongsberg's Kognitwin® solution will be implemented as part of PDO's drive to improve production, safety and cost-efficiency.
title: Kongsberg to deploy AI-powered digital twin for Oman E&P

excerpt: Petrodec’s newly constructed heavy lift jackup vessel, named “Obana,” has begun decommissioning work in the Southern North Sea for Perenco UK (PUK)'s Galahad platform.
title: World's largest jackup rig starts decommissioning work for Perenco UK

excerpt: Expro has set a new benchmark for deepwater well construction, achieving the heaviest casing string deployment to-date for a major operator in the Gulf of America/Gulf of Mexico.
title: Expro sets offshore world record with heaviest casing string deployment

excerpt: Strathcona Resources Ltd. increased its bid for oil sands producer MEG Energy Corp., seeking to break up the oil sands producer’s sale to larger Canadian rival Cenovus Energy Inc.
title: Strathcona continues bid to block rival's MEG takeover

excerpt: Saudi Arabia will cut prices on all of its crude grades for buyers in Asia for next month as well as on most barrels to other regions after OPEC+ said it will continue to increase output, defying widespread expectations of a looming oversupply.
title: Saudis to cut crude prices following OPEC+ decision to boost output

excerpt: The Energy Workforce & Technology Council (EWTC) has published its Well Stimulation Surface Operations Industry Guidelines, providing operators with best practices for hazard identification, risk management, and execution of surface operations during fracture stimulation.
title: Energy Workforce publishes best practices for well stimulation, fracing

excerpt: Well, a few days have gone by, and SPE Offshore Europe (OE) in Aberdeen is now a collection of memories. But, what to make of what was seen and heard during the four-day conference and exhibition? There were many different viewpoints, and, honestly, many contradictions and hypocrisies.
title: Takeaways from Offshore Europe: Britain at an energy crossroads

excerpt: Monkey Island LNG has selected ConocoPhillips’ Optimized Cascade® Process liquefaction technology for its planned 26 MMtpa natural gas liquefaction and export facility in Cameron Parish, Louisiana.
title: ConocoPhillips' technology picked for Monkey Island LNG project

excerpt: OPEC+ leader Saudi Arabia wants the group to consider reviving more oil production ahead of its scheduled return at the end of next year amid a push to reclaim market share, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Saudi Arabia pushes OPEC+ to fast-track production increase

excerpt: India’s Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the country will continue buying Russian oil, signaling its intent to defy U.S. President Donald Trump’s persistent demands to halt the purchases.
title: India will keep buying Russian oil despite Trump demands

excerpt: The Republic of the Congo has signed a $23 billion hydrocarbon deal with China’s Wing Wah to develop the Banga Kayo, Holmoni and Cayo permits, aiming to raise national oil output to 200,000 bpd by 2030.
title: Congo signs $23 billion hydrocarbon deal with China's Wing Wah

excerpt: ADNOC is considering lining up more than $10 billion in debt financing from local and international banks as it moves forward with its roughly $19 billion pursuit of Australian fossil fuel producer Santos Ltd., according to people familiar with the matter.
title: ADNOC seeks over $10 billion in financing for Santos deal

excerpt: OPEC+ has agreed in principle to increase production again next month, according to delegates, as the group doubles down on its policy shift to pursue market share instead of defending prices.
title: OPEC+ agrees to boost output in October as Saudi seeks market share

excerpt: President Donald Trump’s energy chief said there are active discussions in the administration about the future of an offshore wind farm being constructed off the coast of Rhode Island by Denmark’s Orsted A/S, where work was recently halted.
title: Future of Orsted's wind farm in discussions, says U.S. energy chief

excerpt: Angola’s crude output slipped below one million barrels a day in July, threatening state revenues that fund more than 90% of exports. Angola is finalizing a new licensing plan covering 2026 to 2030, which will include both offshore blocks and inland basins, said the head of ANPG.
title: Angola urges more onshore investment to boost oil production

excerpt: Op-Ed: Backed by more than a century of industry leadership, the American Petroleum Institute (API) has helped define what quality and reliability look like for the oil and gas industry, developing widely adopted standards and certification programs that support safe operations.
title: What’s in a name? API and its proprietary marks signify excellence

excerpt: Oil declined on concerns that OPEC+ will once again bolster supply at a meeting on Sunday, compounding fears of higher volumes later in the year. Russian Deputy Prime Minister Alexander Novak said OPEC+ will “look at the current situation as a whole” before making a decision.
title: Oil prices dip amid concerns on upcoming OPEC+ decision

excerpt: PRIO SA, Brava Energia and BW Energy are considering buying Petronas' stake in the Brazilian oil field Tartaruga Verde to expand in Latin America’s largest producing country, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Petronas Brazil field draws interest from several potential bidders

excerpt: Equatorial Guinea will launch its EG Ronda 2026 licensing round later this month. The licensing round forms part of the country’s broader strategy to revitalize its upstream sector, attract new investment and unlock offshore E&P opportunities.
title: Equatorial Guinea to launch 2026 upstream licensing round

excerpt: Unity Well Integrity has announced a strategic partnership with Clear Cut Interventions (CCI) Australia, marking a significant step forward in delivering advanced intervention and well integrity solutions to operators across the Asia-Pac region.
title: New partnership strengthens well intervention capabilities across Australia

excerpt: Shell is testing the market for possible buyers of its 16.67% stake in the North West Shelf LNG export project in Western Australia, which could be worth more than $3 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Shell considers selling $3 billion stake in Australia LNG plant

excerpt: Clariant Oil Services has expanded its commitment to Norwegian oil and gas customers with a new bulk storage and transfer base located in Dusavik, Norway together with its long-standing strategic partner Swire Energy Services.
title: Clariant, Swire Energy Services open new Norway supply base

excerpt: Subsea Technology & Rentals (STR) has appointed experienced sector leader James Christie to head up activities across Europe and Africa following significant growth and plans for further global expansion.
title: STR appoints director to lead expansion across Europe, Africa

excerpt: Oil and natural gas producer ConocoPhillips plans to cut 20% to 25% of its workforce. The majority of the reductions will occur this year, a company spokesman said. The job cuts, first reported by Reuters, include both employees and contractors.
title: ConocoPhillips to cut up to 25% of workforce in 2025 restructuring

excerpt: Alberta’s oil production rose to a record 4.32 million bpd in July as oil sands companies boosted output from well sites to fill the expanded Trans Mountain pipeline. Output from the oil sands also climbed to a record of 3.67 million bpd, according to Alberta Energy Regulator data.
title: Alberta oil output hits record high in July as well production surges

excerpt: JDR Cable Systems (JDR) has been awarded a contract by Liverpool Bay CCS Limited, a member of the Eni SpA group, to supply subsea power cables for its project which will be the backbone of the HyNet North West industrial decarbonization cluster.
title: JDR to supply subsea power cables for Liverpool Bay CCS project

excerpt: Subsea asset integrity management software company Elementz has announced a new digital initiative to fast track the development of AI in subsea operations. The new AI accelerator program, Tide Breaker, was unveiled at Offshore Europe on Wednesday.
title: Aberdeen tech company advances subsea field with launch of AI program

excerpt: Shell’s return to Angola after a 20-year hiatus highlights a shift in sentiment toward the nation’s oil sector, as reforms aimed at attracting global capital start to show results.
title: Shell returns to Angola after two-decade absence

excerpt: Argent LNG has formally submitted its request to enter the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) pre-filing process, marking a critical regulatory milestone in the development of its 25 MMtpa LNG export terminal at Port Fourchon, Louisiana.
title: Argent LNG reaches key regulatory milestone for Port Fourchon

excerpt: Baker Hughes’ equipment is designed to operate with Fervo’s cutting-edge Enhanced Geothermal Systems (EGS), resulting in a fully integrated power plant that drives scalability in sustainable baseload power generation.
title: Baker Hughes expands into U.S. geothermal sector with contract win

excerpt: Commonwealth LNG has received its final non-free trade agreement (non-FTA) export authorization from the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) for its 9.5 MMtpa liquefied natural gas facility in Cameron Parish, Louisiana.
title: Commonwealth LNG granted key approval from U.S. Dept of Energy

excerpt: TechnipFMC has been awarded two subsea contracts by Petrobras for flexible pipe solutions. The first award involves the design, engineering, and manufacturing of flexible gas injection risers in the Santos basin, while the second award involves flexible risers and flowlines for deployment in the Campos basin.
title: TechnipFMC lands subsea contracts with Petrobras worth up to $750 million

excerpt: The Independent Petroleum Association of America (IPAA) Board of Directors has announced the appointment of Edith Naegele as the association’s new President and Chief Executive Officer, effective September 22, 2025.
title: IPAA appoints Edith Naegele as new president and CEO

excerpt: EXCLUSIVE: Offshore Europe’s first-day plenary session was highlighted by Opposition Leader, Conservative Member of Parliament Kemi Badenoch, delivering a somewhat fiery speech in favor of maximizing the UK North Sea’s potential.
title: UK Conservative leader blasts current North Sea policy

excerpt: Between 2020 and 2024, total crude oil and lease condensate production in the United States grew by 1.9 million barrels per day (bpd), 93% of which was produced from just 10 counties in Texas and New Mexico, according to a new report from the Energy Information Administration (EIA).
title: Ten Permian counties account for 93% of U.S. oil production growth since 2020

excerpt: “TotalEnergies is honored to be the first international company to be awarded exploration licenses in a bid round in Nigeria in more than a decade,” commented Kevin McLachlan, Senior Vice-President Exploration at TotalEnergies.
title: TotalEnergies awarded two exploration permits for offshore Nigeria

excerpt: Libya’s state-run energy company is proposing reviving a multibillion-dollar natural gas project to ease electricity shortages, a move that may also be a boon for a rival administration in the country’s east.
title: Libya eyes revival of gas megaproject to tackle power shortages

excerpt: Pemex is offering to buy back some $10 billion worth of its global bonds with cash raised by the Mexican government, according to a statement. The state-owned driller is looking to repurchase 11 series of notes denominated in euros and dollars due between 2026 and 2029.
title: Pemex seeks $10 billion buyback with government-raised funds

excerpt: TotalEnergies has been awarded the Nzombo exploration permit in the Republic of the Congo. The 1,000 square km Nzombo permit is located 100 km off the coast of Pointe-Noire, close to the Moho production facilities.
title: TotalEnergies wins new offshore exploration permit for Republic of Congo

excerpt: Oil traders expect OPEC+ to hold crude production steady when it meets this weekend, as the group pauses after a series of accelerated supply increases.
title: Oil traders expect OPEC+ to hold output flat at upcoming meeting

excerpt: Voters in Guyana headed to the polls to decide whether to reelect President Irfaan Ali or back rivals pledging to squeeze more wealth from ExxonMobil’s offshore oil fields, even as troops came under fire from across the Venezuelan border.
title: Guyana election will steer oil future amid rising Venezuela tensions

excerpt: Nigeria has set a lower threshold by which oil companies can recover their expenses as it seeks to boost government revenue amid lower crude oil prices threatening to widen the budget deficit in the West African nation.
tags: West Africa,Industry Trends,Oil and Gas Prices
title: Nigeria cuts oil firms’ cost-recovery benefits in bid to boost revenue

excerpt: Equinor ASA will spend almost $1 billion backing Orsted A/S’s share sale, in a crucial show of support as the Danish firm seeks to steady its finances following the Trump’s administration’s attacks on offshore wind.
title: Equinor backs Orsted share sales despite Trump targeting wind

excerpt: Equinor has selected BW Offshore as preferred bidder for the FPSO unit for the Bay du Nord project offshore Canada. Bay du Nord, Canada's first deepwater project, is operated by Equinor and bp, and holds an estimated 400 million bbls of recoverable light crude in its initial phase.
title: BW Offshore chosen as preferred bidder for Canada's first deepwater oil project

excerpt: Wood has entered into an agreement to sell its North American Transmission & Distribution engineering business (North America T&D) to Qualus for $110 million.
title: Wood sells North America T&D business for $110 million

excerpt: Kazakhstan is preparing to channel some of its national wealth into artificial intelligence infrastructure, joining a global rush where venture capital firms and energy-rich states are betting billions on the sector despite volatility and surging valuations.
title: Kazakhstan plans to invest chunk of oil wealth into AI infrastructure

excerpt: Argent LNG has formally submitted its Letter of Intent (LOI) and Preliminary Waterway Suitability Assessment (PWSA) to the U.S. Coast Guard, marking a key milestone in the advancement of its flagship LNG export terminal at Port Fourchon, Louisiana.
title: Argent LNG submits key filings to advance Port Fourchon LNG project

excerpt: The Hamm Institute for American Energy at Oklahoma State University has awarded $200,000 in seed grants to OSU faculty members who are tackling challenges in energy security, resilience and innovation. Eight projects were chosen, each receiving $25,000.
title: Hamm Institute awards 8 seed grants to advance energy innovation at OSU

excerpt: In response to the growing requirement to accurately measure and reduce methane emissions from offshore assets, IKM Testing UK has developed and launched its patent-pending technology, Source Level Identification and Quantification (SLIQ).
title: IKM's methane emissions testing technology achieves industry-wide adoption

excerpt: Texas Railroad Commissioner Wayne Christian on Friday praised a new report showing that operators in the Permian basin have reduced methane intensity by 50 percent since 2022, even as oil and natural gas production surged to historic highs.
title: Texas regulator applauds report of 50% reduction in methane intensity

excerpt: Following approval of the 450-mile Eiger Express Pipeline project connecting the Permian basin to Gulf Coast markets, Texas Railroad Commissioner Wayne Christian issued a statement of support, emphasizing the importance of infrastructure in meeting energy demand.
title: Permian to Gulf Coast pipeline a win for energy reliance, says Texas regulator

excerpt: Alberta is projecting a wider deficit for the current fiscal year as oil prices fall, denting a key source of revenue for Canada’s top energy-producing province.
title: Alberta predicts wider budget deficit amid lower oil prices

excerpt: Odfjell Technology has signed a two-year contract with Vercana GmbH, Vulcan Group’s drilling subsidiary, to provide tubular running services (TRS) to Vulcan Group’s Phase One Lionheart Project in Germany.
title: Odfjell lands contract for major geothermal energy project in Germany

excerpt: Borr Drilling has announced contract awards for two of its premium jack-up rigs to operate in the North Sea as well as offshore Congo, West Africa. The contracted work will span over 300 days and represent more than $43 million in contract revenue backlog, Borr Drilling said.
title: Borr Drilling lands new contracts for North Sea, West Africa

excerpt: Two SLB OneSubsea™ subsea compressor stations recently came online at Ormen Lange, the second largest gas field in Norway. The subsea compressor stations will help Shell unlock 30–50 billion cubic meters of additional gas reserves for export to Europe.
title: SLB starts up two subsea compressor stations at Shell gas field in Norway

excerpt: Oceaneering has won contracts to provide work class remotely operated vehicle (ROV) services, specialized tooling packages, and survey services onboard multiple anchor handling and ROV support vessels working on Petrobras projects offshore Brazil.
title: Petrobras awards $180 million in subsea robotics contracts to Oceaneering

excerpt: ExxonMobil said net zero goals for the global energy sector are likely to drift further beyond 2050 due to consumers pushing back against high costs and a revival in demand for coal, the most polluting fossil fuel.
title: Exxon says net zero goals have slipped as coal use rises

excerpt: During a state visit to Brasilía this week, Nigerian President Bola Tinubu welcomed Petrobras’s planned re-entry into the Nigerian market. The two countries signed five Memoranda of Understanding, signaling a shift from symbolic ties to practical, high-impact collaboration.
title: Petrobras to re-enter Nigeria five years after halting JV operations

excerpt: EnerMech has secured a two-year contract extension with Dubai Petroleum to continue providing the Middle East operator with crane maintenance services across its offshore assets.
title: EnerMech wins two-year cranes contract extension with Dubai Petroleum

excerpt: When completed, FLNG Hilli Episeyo will be redeployed in the Gulf of San Matias in the Rio Negro province offshore Argentina, liquifying gas from the Vaca Muerta shale formation onshore in Neuquen province for 20 years.
title: Seatrium signs FLNG vessel upgrade contract with Golar

excerpt: Xodus founder Steve Swindell is stepping down from his role as CEO after 20 years with the global energy consultancy, with Stuart Holley of Subsea7 set to take over as Xodus CEO starting October 1.
title: Xodus appoints new CEO as founder steps down

excerpt: ADNOC has agreed to supply 1 million tons of LNG annually to IndianOil for 15 years as it lines up more binding contracts for a new export terminal. The LNG will come primarily from the under-construction project at Ruwais.
title: ADNOC enters 15-year LNG supply deal with IndianOil

excerpt: Subsea7 has landed a major contract with the Turkish Petroleum Offshore Technology Center (TP-OTC) for the development of phase 3 of the Sakarya field development in the Black Sea, offshore Türkiye.
title: Subsea7 wins major contract for offshore Türkiye gas field development

excerpt: Verlume has entered into a strategic collaboration with Kraken Robotics, marking an industry-first crossover: the introduction of military-grade battery technology into the commercial offshore energy sector for the first time.
title: Kraken Robotics teams up with Verlume on subsea power storage solutions

excerpt: EnQuest along with its joint venture partners and the Government of Indonesia have signed Production Sharing Contracts (PSCs) for the Gaea and Gaea II exploration blocks, located in Papua Barat, Indonesia.
title: EnQuest, partners ink deal with Indonesia for Gaea exploration blocks

excerpt: Zephyr Energy has completed its $7.3 million acquisition of working interests in accretive, mature proved developed producing (PDP) assets in core Rocky Mountain basins. In addition to the PDP assets, the acquisition includes additional acreage with potential for future development.
title: Zephyr Energy acquires key producing assets in Rocky Mountain basins

excerpt: International industrial services provider Bilfinger has secured a contract to provide inspection services using Non-Destructive Testing (NDT) across all of bp’s North Sea assets.
title: Bilfinger to provide inspection services across all bp North Sea assets

excerpt: Baker Hughes has secured a comprehensive 90-month service agreement award from bp for its Tangguh LNG plant in Indonesia. The agreement covers spare parts, repair services, and field service engineering support for critical turbomachinery at the facility.
title: Baker Hughes scores long-term contract for bp's Tangguh LNG

excerpt: STRYDE has announced the sale of multiple Mini Seismic Systems, including ~2,000 nodes, to support a groundbreaking new initiative in UK academic research. The investment is led by the University of Cambridge and backed by six other leading institutions.
title: STRYDE's mini seismic systems to be used for UK academic research

excerpt: “This represents an important milestone for Block, Georgia and our partner on the pilot project, Indorama, as we seek to demonstrate the viability of large-scale, low-cost CCS," said Block Energy's CEO Paul Haywood.
title: Block Energy completes CO2 pilot injection for Eastern Europe CCS project

excerpt: U.S. President Trump reiterated his opposition to wind power in a Tuesday cabinet meeting, as his administration has in recent weeks moved more aggressively to restrict projects by blocking approvals, halting construction and invalidating necessary permits.
title: Trump reaffirms action against wind projects in Tuesday meeting

excerpt: TotalEnergies and its partners, Equinor and Shell, announce that the first CO2 volumes were successfully transported to the Northern Lights facilities in Øygarden. They were then injected 2,600 m below the seabed into the storage facilities, offshore Norway.
title: Northern Lights CCS project achieves first CO2 injection, storage milestone

excerpt: Seadrill Limited today announced Sonadrill Holding Ltd, its 50:50 joint venture with an affiliate of Sonangol E.P., has been awarded two contracts. The West Gemini secured a contract with Sonangol Exploração & Produção, S.A. for work in Angola.
title: Seadrill announces contracts in Angola for Sonadrill joint venture

excerpt: PXGEO has secured its first contract in Malaysia to deliver offshore seismic data acquisition services under a two-year agreement. The campaign will play a key role in supporting Malaysia’s drive to unlock new hydrocarbon resources and accelerate upstream exploration.
title: PXGEO wins two-year geophysical contract to support Malaysia upstream activity

excerpt: OKEA ASA has announced oil discoveries made in the Cook and Statfjord formations of Norway's Brage Field. The discoveries are considered commercial with preliminary estimates of gross recoverable resources in the range of 16 to 33 million MMboe.
title: OKEA confirms commercial oil discovery in Norway's Brage Field

excerpt: Ace Well Technology, in collaboration with Expro and Archer, has successfully completed the first well deployment of the Ace Control Line Clamp (ACLC) using Expro’s Remote Clamp Installation System (RCIS) on the Norwegian Continental Shelf (NCS).
title: Key milestone reached for automated well construction offshore Norway

excerpt: Crescent Energy today announced a definitive agreement to acquire shale rival Vital Energy in an all-stock transaction valued at approximately $3.1 billion. The merger positions Crescent as a top 10 independent producer, with a scaled and focused asset portfolio across the Eagle Ford, Permian and Uinta Basins.
title: Crescent Energy to acquire Vital in $3.1 billion all-stock deal

excerpt: SLB announced today that its OneSubsea™ joint venture has been awarded an engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) contract by Equinor for a 12-well, all-electric Subsea Production System (SPS) in the Fram Sør field, offshore Norway.

title: ABB Customer World: How digitalization is elevating chemical, oil and gas industry processes

excerpt: HOUSTON -- During a CTO panel discussion, Ahmed Hashmi, head of upstream technology at BP, discussed how research and development in the oil and gas industry is keeping up with the increasing change in technology, and where the future of R&D will take the industry, at ABB Customer World Wednesday morning.
title: ABB Customer World: How R&D keeps pace with technological advances in oil and gas

excerpt: HOUSTON -- No matter what industry you work in, improving and instituting automation efficiency can lead to operational excellence. This idea was the theme of Wednesday morning’s keynote presentation “Next level operational excellence: Efficiency in automation” at ABB Customer World 2017.
title: ABB Customer World: Automation efficiency and the future of operational excellence

excerpt: HOUSTON -- When it comes to transporting natural gas (methane), pipelines offer the safest option. But preserving safety means constant vigilance for the pipeline operator, and a reliance on detection systems to pinpoint leaks.
title: ABB Customer World: A quantum leap in leak detection

excerpt: HOUSTON -- Magnetostrictive technology is one of the most accurate liquid level transmitter technologies in the world today. ABB has supplied industry-leading level instrumentation for years, and is now introducing a new range of magnetostrictive level transmitters, the LMT Series.
title: ABB Customer World: ABB unveils new line of level transmitters

excerpt: HOUSTON -- Moving automation off the critical path of project execution requires agility as well as speed. Configurable single channel input/output (I/O) systems and fully digital instrument communications have advanced both causes.
title: ABB Customer World: Standards, tools and clouds: speeding up engineering workflows

excerpt: HOUSTON -- ABB’s xStream engineering methodology is so named because it enables project teams to perform multiple (“x”) tasks simultaneously in parallel work “streams.” Representative of this concept is the Ethernet I/O Wizard in the company’s flagship control system 800xA.
title: ABB Customer World: Under the hood of xStream, ABB’s process control engineering methodology

excerpt: HOUSTON -- Presented by EUCI, ABB Customer World held the “Leadership for women in industry” workshop on Wednesday.
title: ABB Customer World: Women 'say yes' to opportunity in STEM

excerpt: HOUSTON -- The advent of input/output (I/O) hardware systems that are fully flexible on a single-channel basis has remarkably wide-ranging implications when it comes to project risk. Each analog I/O channel and module starts out essentially identical to the next; entire I/O cabinets—fully assembled with redundant power supplies and network connections—can be ordered with a single part number.
title: ABB Customer World: Marshalling field instruments the digital way

excerpt: HOUSTON -- Rotating equipment is the most common cause of downtime or reduced production in OGC plants. Monitoring the condition of that equipment is often performed manually by maintenance personnel, but this practice is expensive and often inefficient. ABB has recently presented ABB Ability, its platform for industrial IoT technologies.
title: ABB Customer World: Smart sensors, new platforms safeguard rotating machinery

excerpt: HOUSTON -- In the process control arena, “convergence” has been a growing trend for years as more and more functionality from previously disparate systems is consolidated behind a single user interface. One important aspect of any process is the electric power system that supports it, but to date most process control systems have not modeled it in a robust way. This has implications, notably with regard to operator effectiveness, safety and project delays.
title: ABB Customer World: Simulating power for better control

excerpt: HOUSTON -- Located about 180 miles (288 kilometers) southwest of Toronto, NOVA Chemicals' Corunna site is a petrochemical complex that produces 1.8 billion pounds of ethylene and up to 700 million pounds of co-products annually. The facility started up in late 1977 and was purchased by NOVA Chemicals in 1988. It was the first fully integrated refinery and petrochemical complex in North America and today employs 495 people.
title: ABB Customer World: Virtualization boosts process control at NOVA Chemicals

excerpt: HOUSTON -- Research and development is the lifeblood of ABB. Every year, the company devotes more than a billion dollars to the function, which includes our seven global Corporate Research Centers (CRCs) as well as R&D activities within business units.
title: ABB Customer World: Catch a glimpse of the future at the Innovation Lab

excerpt: HOUSTON -- Oil and gas projects have been conducted the same way for decades. According to an EY report, 64% of projects face cost overruns and over 70% are reporting a schedule delay. This has inevitably led to the pursuit of rethinking the way oil and gas companies conduct projects. This idea was the main topic of Tuesday’s plenary session “Innovation in project execution is causing the chemical, oil and gas industry to think differently” at ABB Customer World 2017.
title: ABB Customer World: Intelligent projects model is the future of oil and gas project execution

excerpt: HOUSTON -- ABB commercially launched ABB Ability™ at ABB Customer World 2017 in Houston this week, introducing customers to the new digital solutions portfolio that combines cutting-edge technologies to deliver impressive solutions and services that aid in solving a variety of potential complications faced in utilities, industry, transport and infrastructure.
title: ABB Customer World: ABB unveils digital solutions portfolio, ABB Ability™

excerpt: HOUSTON -- The process industries’ newest production assets have never been larger or more complicated. But with increased scale and complexity has come a growing inability to predictably deliver capital projects on schedule and within budget. Key contributors to this growing risk are late design changes that tend to cascade throughout a project, causing delays and budget overruns.
title: ABB Customer World: Eliminating I/O surprises with flexible single-channel system

excerpt: HOUSTON -- Condition-based maintenance is something all oil and gas operations seem to be chasing these days, and for good reason. Performing maintenance only when it is needed is common sense, but in a low oil price environment it becomes an essential tool in managing cost.
title: ABB Customer World: AssetInsight drives smarter maintenance

excerpt: HOUSTON -- This year at ABB Customer World, one of the many new products being introduced is the LLT100, a new laser level transmitter from the company’s Measurement and Analytics business. It’s specifically made for industrial applications and harsh environments.
title: ABB Customer World: How many ways can you use laser level detection?

excerpt: HOUSTON -- Collaboration and connectivity is key within the digital revolution, ABB CEO Ulrich Spiesshofer said during the welcome keynote address Tuesday morning at ABB Customer World in Houston.
title: ABB Customer World: Preparing for the digital revolution

excerpt: HOUSTON -- It’s no secret that upstream oil and gas operators have had to dramatically cut back their investments in recent years due to low crude prices. Prices have improved from their sub-$40 nadir in late 2015, but long-term investment decisions are still challenging. But one area of research and development has continued on even while others were cancelled: subsea technology.
title: ABB Customer World: Powering an offshore platform on the sea bed

excerpt: WALTON-ON-THAMES, England -- Plexus Holdings PLC announced that it will launch its new POS-GRIP Python Subsea Wellhead during Europe’s biggest Oil and Gas trade show, ‘SPE Offshore Europe’, on Sep. 8, 2015. The new Python Subsea Wellhead, previously referred to as the “HGSS” Wellhead, has been designed to address key technical issues and requirements highlighted by regulators following the Gulf of Mexico incident in April 2010 and to achieve a new best in class standard for subsea wellheads that can for the first time match those of premium couplings.
title: Plexus announces product launch date for POS-GRIP Python Subsea Wellhead

Accordingly, the first-ever GPS Awards event was held on Tuesday at the Stampede show grounds in Calgary.
title: GPS '15: First-ever GPS Awards handed out to industry firms in Calgary

excerpt: Shenzi is BHP Billiton’s flagship project in deepwater Gulf of Mexico. The operator presented a panel of E&P executives at a press, who collectively outlined the exploration, drilling and production aspects of the project and showcased milestones, which classify Shenzi as a world-class development.
title: OTC ’15: BHP Billiton makes case for Shenzi as world class project

excerpt: HOUSTON -- Experts from the offshore energy industry around the world came together 4–7 May for the 2015 Offshore Technology Conference (OTC) at NRG Park in Houston. More than 94,700 attendees from 130 countries gathered at the annual conference, representing the sixth-largest attendance in the OTC’s 47-year history.
title: OTC 2015 draws over 94,700 for show’s sixth-largest attendance

excerpt: SINGAPORE -- Asia’s leading small-mid scale event, the 4th Annual Asia Pacific Small & Mid-Scale LNG (APAC LNG) Forum will gather energy and maritime professionals from May 13 to 15 to drive discussions on critical issues transforming Asia’s energy and maritime landscape.
title: Small-mid scale projects to pave future for Asia’s energy and maritime landscape

excerpt: Houston -- With lower oil prices and smaller margins, good project management is more important than ever, yet operators are often challenged when moving from field development projects into the operational phase. DNV GL has therefore developed a framework and roadmap for planning operations. This will support smaller operators in the transition from exploration to production to ensure a safe and cost-efficient operation.
title: OTC ’15: DNV GL supports operators moving from exploration to production

excerpt: HOUSTON -- Baker Hughes has announced the commercial release of its Vault barrier valve, which provides an ISO-qualified barrier in the wellbore to help protect the lower completion and minimize costly fluid loss during well construction.
title: OTC '15: Baker Hughes introduces V1-rated barrier valve for HPHT environments

excerpt: HOUSTON -- Lloyd’s Register Energy has spent this week at the Offshore Technology Conference (OTC) 2015 in Texas challenging oil and gas companies to re-think their approach to safety, performance and technical innovation to secure the world’s energy supply in a sustainable way, from reservoir and refinery to beyond.
title: OTC ’15: Lloyd’s Register Energy closes OTC with call for collaboration

title: OTC ’15: BSEE announces key efforts to reduce risk offshore

excerpt: At a time when the oil and gas industry has laid off more than 100,000 workers, one oilfield engineering firm is welcoming resumes from professionals for high-level technical and management positions.

excerpt: HOUSTON -- Weir Oil & Gas has announced its latest innovation to increase customer efficiency and performance. The new SPM QEM 3000 is the industry’s first high-horse power frac pump designed for continuous-duty pressure pumping operation at 275,000 pound force rod load, all the time.
title: OTC '15:  Weir Oil & Gas launches SPM QEM 3000 Frac Pump

excerpt: HOUSTON -- Baker Hughes has commercially released its FTeX advanced formation pressure testing service, which uses downhole automation and real-time control of an intelligent packer and pump configuration to deliver critical formation data, including pressure profiles, fluid contact and mobility information-reliably, accurately and efficiently.

title: OTC '15: Relatively unaffected by low prices, Abu Dhabi pursues major expansion

excerpt: The Lower Tertiary Wilcox trend is at the leading edge of the deepwater frontier in the Gulf of Mexico. Following the successes of Shell’s Perdido (120 Mbopd) and Petrobras’ Cascade (40 Mbopd) is Chevron’s Jack-St Malo (JSM) field, which produced first oil on December 1, 2014.
title: OTC ’15: Chevron’s Jack-St Malo – Lower Tertiary success, on time and under budget

excerpt: A variety of Canadian officials and industry analysts painted a hopeful picture of their country’s upstream market at an OTC Industry Breakfast session.

excerpt: HOUSTON -- Halliburton’s Testing and Subsea business line announced Monday that its RezConnect Well Testing System, the industry’s first solution to offer complete acoustic control of drill-stem tools, received the Offshore Technology Conference (OTC) 2015 Spotlight on New Technology Award.

excerpt: HOUSTON -- Baker Hughes announced the introduction of its Hammerhead system—the industry’s first fully integrated wellhead-to-reservoir ultradeepwater completion and production system— at OTC 2015 on Monday.

excerpt: HOUSTON -- GE announced a new water treatment technology for the upstream oil and gas market on Monday at this year's OTC. GE’s new seawater sulfate removal (SWSR) nanofiltration membrane eliminates almost all sulfate from injection water in offshore oil production.
title: OTC ’15: GE introduces membrane to remove seawater sulfate from injection water

excerpt: HOUSTON -- FMC has chosen DNV GL to perform independent third-party verification of a high pressure, high temperature (HPHT) subsea completion, production and work-over system. FMC is running this project as a joint industry program (JIP) with Anadarko, BP, Conoco Phillips, and Shell, to aim at product standardization and cost efficiency.
title: OTC ’15: DNV GL wins verification contract for FMC’s 20K JIP

excerpt: HOUSTON -- The management of data will emerge as a key component in the future as offshore drilling moves ahead, and must find solutions to the vast amount of it being processed, an industry leader said at an opening session of the 2015 Offshore Technology Conference in Houston, Texas.

excerpt: HOUSTON -- Halliburton’s Completion Tools business line has introduced the VersaFlex XtremeGrip expandable liner hanger system.
title: OTC '15: Halliburton introduces new metal-to-metal expandable liner hanger system

excerpt: At a time when crude oil prices have declined drastically and rig counts are dropping, the chief upstream strategist for IHS offered a hopeful vision for deepwater exploration to OTC delegates.
title: OTC ’15: Deepwater offers opportunities to fill supply gap of 20 MMbopd by 2040

excerpt: CALGARY, Alberta -- ShaleTech Canada opened in the Tellus Conference Centre in Calgary with speakers emphasizing export of Canadian resources and know-how, with Canada playing an important role in the North America energy Renaissance.
title: ShaleTech Canada '15: Canadian exports take center stage at inaugural conference

excerpt: SINGAPORE -- A series of factors and influences have propelled the demand for small to mid-scale LNG projects in Asia. The upcoming 4th Annual Asia Pacific Small & Mid-Scale LNG (APAC LNG) Forum this May will gather the supply chain’s leading practitioners and specialists to discuss these influences and help shape future developments.
title: Growing demand for small-mid scale LNG in Asia Pacific

excerpt: HOUSTON -- Weatherford has announced the commercial release of its TruFrac composite frac plug at the 2015 Intervention and Coiled Tubing Association (ICoTA) Conference and Exhibition.
title: ICoTA 2015: Weatherford announces TruFrac composite frac plug

excerpt: NICOSIA, Cyprus -- Gulf Publishing Company opened its third annual Eastern Mediterranean Gas Conference (EMGC) with a welcome from John Royall, President of Gulf Publishing Company. Royall thanked attendees for coming to the event and said that he believes the Eastern Mediterranean region will continue to grow over the long term with respect to exploration efforts and reserves. He also believes the downturn in the oil and gas market and pricing will be short lived, which he later addressed in a forecast presentation based on Gulf Publishing Company's World Oil data.
title: EMGC 2015: Gas leaders examine roles of Egypt, Cyprus in future trade

excerpt: NICOSIA, Cyprus -- During the Day 1 lunch presentation at EMGC 2015, Bill R. Alashqar, Managing Director of US Independents for GE Oil & Gas, shared his perspective on the power of networks globally and in the U.S.
title: EMGC 2015: Industry experts call for clarity on Eastern Med trade laws

excerpt: Eastern Mediterranean Gas Conference (EMGC) 2015 is the premier event for professionals working in, or seeking to be involved in, the significant offshore gas reserves in the Eastern Mediterranean.
title: EMGC 2015 to examine export options for Eastern Mediterranean gas producers

excerpt: CALGARY, Alberta -- ShaleTech Canada 2015 is the premier event for professionals working in the shale oil and gas industry in Canada, which is the world's fifth-largest oil producer. With a strong focus on technology, attendees will learn about drilling, production and processing advancements from leading operators and technology providers in shale energy.
title: Inaugural ShaleTech Canada offers unique forum for networking, technology sharing
Gastech 2015 Singapore seeks papers on gas, LNG market outlook

excerpt: LONDON -- The low oil price and high project costs mean countries are under pressure to make oil and gas licensing rounds as attractive as possible for bidders if they are to be successful.
title: Launching licensing rounds in tough times

excerpt: DENVER, Colorado – The hectic pace of the international exploration industry and the rise of computer intensive big data is leading companies to take a closer look at cloud computing. Leo Reiter of Nimbix, a provider of cloud-based high-performance computing infrastructure and applications, delivered a presentation on cloud computing to industry representatives on the opening day of the SEG’s annual conference in Denver.
title: SEG ’14: Explorers looking to the cloud for big data solutions

excerpt: AMSTERDAM – At the concluding ceremony of the SPE ATCE, 2014 President Jeff Spath, Schlumberger, passed on the president's gavel to Helge Hove Haldorsen, Statoil, who assumed the organization’s lead role for 2015.
title: SPE ’14: New President Haldorsen urges a ‘bigger tent’ for SPE

excerpt: DENVER, Colorado -- The technological innovations behind the shale revolution transformed North America’s resource potential and the U.S. economy in the aftermath of the worst financial crisis since the Great Depression, SEG 2014 heard. The breakthroughs behind the U.S. shale boom were among a number of disruptive technologies identified by the McKinsey Global Institute (MGI), the business and economics research arm of McKinsey & Company.
title: SEG ’14: Shale revolution transformed U.S. resources, economy

excerpt: AMSTERDAM – A panel of industry experts urged continued investment in oil and gas projects despite the 20% drop in oil prices at the inaugural session on affordable energy at the 2014 SPE Annual Technical Conference & Exhibition (ATCE).
title: SPE 2014: Industry panel warns against exaggerated reaction to oil price drop

excerpt: HOUSTON – In its thirteenth year of honoring the upstream energy industry's top innovators and innovations, World Oil announced the winners of its 2014 World Oil Awards during a black tie gala in Houston. This year's honorees took home trophies in 16 categories, covering areas as diverse as drilling and data management. The evening's Master of Ceremony was Shara Fryer, Morning News Anchor, KTRH. The ceremony began with a keynote speech from James Pappas, President of the Ultra-Deepwater Programs for RPSEA, the Research Partnership to Secure Energy for America.
title: Industry innovations honored at 2014 World Oil Awards
